story:
#ClimateAction

 

 

#UNFCCC

elliott footwear, a humble member of the United Nation's Climate Change Program:

 

WALK WITH A CLIMATE POSITIVE FOOTPRINT

FOOTPRINT: EACH PAIR OF elliott HELPS OUR PLANET BY OFFSETTING 1 TONNE OF CO2 EMISSION = CAPTURED BY 45 TREES THROUGH A YEAR OR 1429 LAUNDRY WASHES
 

STYLES: 

elliott Classic Low Vegan-leather White

 

elliott Classic Low Vegan-suede Dark Navy

 

elliott Classic Low R-Canvas White/Green

 

elliott High-Top R-Canvas White/Strips 

 

Overview

 

Certified by:

 

Pre-Order Now

...or scroll down the page for size guide

 

The Climate Positive Definition:

Climate positive means that elliott goes beyond achieving net zero carbon emissions to create an actual environmental benefit by removing additional carbon dioxide from the atmosphere.

 

 

#elliottfootwear

We have designed a collection of wardrobe essential sneakers. A selection of timeless, simple and iconic sneakers; with vulcanized soles to give them a clean aesthetic.

 


 

SIZE GUIDE 

How to measure your foot correctly:

 

 

THE SHOE

DESIGN / SPECS / FABRICS / MANUFACTURER

 

 

Design: 

Our ambition; achieve a highly aesthetic and clean look - the perfect  silhouette 

 

Technical specs.

 

RECYCLE Canvas

Our R-Canvas models are made with state-of-the-art recycle fabric, produced with solar-powered energy and using almost zero water - Lowest possible impact on our planet. #SDG

 

 

VEGAN Fabric (faux leather)

 

 

 

How to Pre-order with Indiegogo

1. Click “Back this Project”: Select the available reward tier you would like to pledge on the right side of the page or click here. Each backer may only make one pledge.    

2. Payment: Enter your payment information. By doing so, you are only allowing Indiegogo to charge you the cost of the pledge at that same moment.

3. SIZE(s), STYLE(s) &  SHIPPING Information: Don’t worry about that yet! You will receive a survey to confirm your size, favourite model(s), and shipping information after submitting your pledge and the campaign has ended.

To all Backers: We will ship elliott footwear worldwide via a trackable parcel delivery service. Please note that you may be 100% responsible for duties, fees, customs and taxes applicable to your region and/or country, for more info check the FAQ. All the goods will be shipped from Spain.

 

 

 

Get one pair with 59% off

incl. free shipping to CA, EU & US

GO TO TOP

 

 

 

MILESTONE HIGHLIGHT:

WHAT A DAY!  26.09.2018: The day we received the final samples.

 

 

Defining elliott:

 

 

 

We are out of time and 

must act now... to ensure 

a sustainable tomorrow!

elliott

 

 

 

 

 

Visit elliott on web & social media:

Instagram: @elliottfootwear

Facebook: facebook.com/elliottfootwear

Pinterest: @elliottfootwear

Twitter: @elliottfootwear

 

Additional questions? 
Contact us at info@elliottfootwear.com

PRESS & PR:

Telefon +45 53701204

Mail PRESS@elliottfootwear.com

 

 

INFO

 

Refund Policy

What is your refund policy?

Indiegogo's refund policy states:

"For campaign backers: Backers can process a refund for their transaction made to a crowdfunding campaign on Indiegogo, provided a campaign is live and not ended, the perk claimed has not been fulfilled, and the funds have not been disbursed to the campaigner.

 

Risk & Challenges 

This is not the first start-up we’ve made. Which is why we know which part of the process that is vital for a successful launch.

In the last year, we’ve assembled a strong supply chain, from the materials suppliers to manufacturers to quality control to shipping and fulfillment partners, so we’re confident that we can deliver high-quality footwear to you in time.

Once our campaign is funded, we are ready to head straight to full production mode. Our material supplier and factory partner are on stand by and waiting for the go signal. As the shoes go into production, we will personally travel to Spain for overseeing the production to make sure that we don’t run into any issues.

As with any product, unforeseen delays can happen. We’ve intentionally padded our schedule to accommodate these changes. We promise to keep our backers updated throughout the process and let you know if we foresee any updates to the delivery timeline.

 

Ethical Manufacturing

As part of our selection process, we ensure that the partners we chose have strong ethical practices as it relates to their workforce. We walk around the factory to make sure that the conditions are safe and sanitary. We specifically look for family-run factories that focus on higher-end skilled labour because we consider them our trusted manufacturing partners.

 

Quality Control

In order to ensure that the final product that gets shipped out to our customers is up to standard, we work with a third-party quality control company. The firm is run by our agent, based locally near the factory, so we always have a set of eyes and ears on the ground. 

 

 

EXTRA

 

Our media campaign in Berlin

elliott introduction campaign capturing the city life in Berlin. Showing our footwear collection in an all year look though a series of portrait shots in the area where Bowie lived and walked the streets.  

Photographer: Sophus Ritto 

Follow us on Instagram @elliottfootwear

 

 

 

 

 

GO TO TOP

 

 

 

© 2019 Selskabet 0818

story:
If in our first campaign we focused on outstanding technology at affordable prices, we are now determined to take this to the next level and designed our frames as an extension to your body, lightweight, with the latest technology materials and smart models. We are now focusing on YOU and your look, using a fresh design.

When we decided to perfect the business model for our luxury glasses, we realized that we needed to rethink three important aspects: design, quality and distribution. We are determined not only to improve the quality of the product and the distribution network but also its design, making sure your Lance Glasses become your essential fashion accessory.
 

Reduce the glare and see clearer with our Sharp Lenses or choose the Fade Lenses that automatically darken when you go outside.

Fade® Lenses - Eyeglasses and sunglasses, instantly in the same pair. Quick change. Fade lenses are clear indoors and darker to 70% in bright sunlight. A nice and welcome upgrade for your eyes. Our transition technology called Fade® Lenses, enables you to have more pairs of glasses in one perfect pair.

Sharp® Lenses - You can choose between the view lenses with blue light protection and sunglasses lenses.  Do you want to keep it simple? We thought of you and without making any compromises! Keeping all the functions of our lenses, we created Sharp® Lenses, giving you the possibility to choose between our plain lenses and sunglasses lenses.

The Sharp® Lenses are the most evolved digital life lenses. The nanotechnology coatings are acting as a shield against blue light from your daily exposure to screens. 

The main source of HEV light in our lives is the harmful blue-violet light emitted by our digital screens. From TVs to tablets, computers to phones, we’re constantly exposing ourselves to the unnatural blue light. Having Sharp Lenses on your Lance Glasses will limit the amount of blue light that enters your eyes, making your screen time more pleasant.

Each pair is made of first-rate materials. We believe that quality isn’t optional or just too expensive. High-quality metal or Italian acetate obtained from hardened cotton flocks compose our frames in order to create an exquisite final product. Their weight and smart bridge will make you forget that you’re even wearing glasses.

Your opinion matters to us and we are always interested in hearing your thoughts and experience feedback. For that reason we are aware of your issues and suggestions and built the most stylish and smart eyewear pairs in the world!

Acetate prototypes, matte and glossy black. The final product will not have transparent areas on the temples - this is a prototype stage section in order for you to see the technology used inside.

We believe that the glasses are an extension of your body, not a bothering issue. They should complete your style and we want to play an active role in this process and help you create the desired image.Our designs are unique and specially created for you based on face anatomy research and current trends so that you can look and feel perfect all the time.

The story of our design started in Morez (Jura Valley) considered the Silicon Valley of glasses, moved to Lille, France – Euratechnologies (Startups Incubator), Lance was founded to set your mind free from the endless search for overpriced glasses and help you focus on the things that really matter! 

We’ve teamed up with world class designers and high-tech manufacturers to craft above standard, strong, lightweight frames with high standard lenses, at a price that you’ll definitely find interesting. We have succeeded in combining modern Parisian designs inspired by current trends with French culture and tradition. 

It has al begun in 1796 in Les Arcets, a hamlet in Morez where Pierre-Hyacinthe Caseaux, an ingenious craftsman, had the idea of stretching and twisting a nail to make spectacles.

While we manufacture our frames to the highest standard of quality.If you feel that the frame did not meet your expectations, simply contact us and we will replace the frame. Does that sound fair? :-) Then you should hurry up and reserve your eyewear. 

During the first campaign, many people asked us about our process. We do everything in the house and we want to make sunglasses and eyeglasses that do not weigh you down. That's why we started this in the first place. 

Our process begins with mood boards, shapes, colours, research and story made by our product developer and art director, Liviu. Our designer, Luc, creates the first sketches and drawings and the process continues with our engineer, Karim and our production manager, Gonzague, that manage the entire production from searching suppliers, making prototypes, quality checks and production planning to sending the glasses to their new owners.

Once the campaign ends, you will be able to try the new virtual mirror that now works also from your smartphone so you can be sure that you’re make the best choice! Finding the right frame style for your face shape might feel tricky, but thankfully our app helps you pick the right frame and it is so easy.

We want to offer you the possibility to match your frames to your style and the occasions you enjoy so we designed quality frames at a fair price. We’re not just for show. We strongly believe that a good design isn’t only about looking good. Seeing good is also a must. Lance enables you to have the best option without stressful research on lenses coatings. Our team, along with the best opticians, have selected and implemented the best for you.  Using the most advanced optical software and industry-leading machinery, Lance can handle the most complicated corections with an extraordinary level of accuracy and optical clarity, including digital free-form lenses.

 
All of our lenses are maximum UV-protection and provide a 100% filter from harmful UVA, UVB and UVC rays including the blue light from digital screens. The invisible coatings make your glasses your best daily ally adapting to any situation.
 

At the end of each month, we will send you a survey so you can choose your favourite model, colour and whether you need prescription lenses or not.

We remove all the intermediaries and offer luxury glasses, three times cheaper than the store pricing. Our engineer and co-founder, Karim Bousbaine, has optimized and simplified processes and the management for the largest multinationals all over the world. He has used the experience gained in the last 15 years in the Lance Glasses fabrication process and so we have made this price possible, enabling us to offer you Luxury Limited Edition eyeglasses for less than 100€.

 

Check some of the feedback that our previous happy customers shared on our site.

Over the past year, we have developed our new Lance collection, improving and testing multiple prototypes until reaching perfection. Based in Lille, France, our team comes from different horizons, making our company’s vision richer. Our philosophy is deliciously simple. We produce a luxury product meeting the standards of the best brands on the market at an honest price.

Glasses Model: Haussmann Ace & Steel / Color : Shiny Palladium & Glossy Black Acetate

Glasses Model: Haussmann Ace & Steel / Color: Gold Green Transparent

Glasses Model: Haussmann Classic / Color: Matte Green Transparent and Matte Transparent

Glasses Model: Opera / Color: Matte Green Transparent and Matte Transparent

Glasses Model: Opera / Color: Matte Green Transparent and Matte Transparent

Glasses Model: Haussmann Smart Metal / Color: Matte Palladium - Glasses Model: Haussmann Ace&Steel / Color : Matte Green Transparent

Glasses Model: Steve Smart Metal / Color: Gold

Glasses Model: Steve Smart Metal / Color: Matte Palladium

Glasses Model: Haussmann Ace & Steel / Color: Shiny Gold & Green Matte Transparent
story_txt: If in our first campaign we focused on outstanding technology at affordable prices, we are now determined to take this to the next level and designed our frames as an extension to your body, lightweight, with the latest technology materials and smart models. We are now focusing on YOU and your look, using a fresh design.When we decided to perfect the business model for our luxury glasses, we realized that we needed to rethink three important aspects: design, quality and distribution. We are determined not only to improve the quality of the product and the distribution network but also its design, making sure your Lance Glasses become your essential fashion accessory. Reduce the glare and see clearer with our Sharp Lenses or choose the Fade Lenses that automatically darken when you go outside.Fade® Lenses - Eyeglasses and sunglasses, instantly in the same pair. Quick change. Fade lenses are clear indoors and darker to 70% in bright sunlight. A nice and welcome upgrade for your eyes. Our transition technology called Fade® Lenses, enables you to have more pairs of glasses in one perfect pair.Sharp® Lenses - You can choose between the view lenses with blue light protection and sunglasses lenses.  Do you want to keep it simple? We thought of you and without making any compromises! Keeping all the functions of our lenses, we created Sharp® Lenses, giving you the possibility to choose between our plain lenses and sunglasses lenses.The Sharp® Lenses are the most evolved digital life lenses. The nanotechnology coatings are acting as a shield against blue light from your daily exposure to screens. The main source of HEV light in our lives is the harmful blue-violet light emitted by our digital screens. From TVs to tablets, computers to phones, we’re constantly exposing ourselves to the unnatural blue light. Having Sharp Lenses on your Lance Glasses will limit the amount of blue light that enters your eyes, making your screen time more pleasant.Each pair is made of first-rate materials. We believe that quality isn’t optional or just too expensive. High-quality metal or Italian acetate obtained from hardened cotton flocks compose our frames in order to create an exquisite final product. Their weight and smart bridge will make you forget that you’re even wearing glasses.Your opinion matters to us and we are always interested in hearing your thoughts and experience feedback. For that reason we are aware of your issues and suggestions and built the most stylish and smart eyewear pairs in the world!Acetate prototypes, matte and glossy black. The final product will not have transparent areas on the temples - this is a prototype stage section in order for you to see the technology used inside.We believe that the glasses are an extension of your body, not a bothering issue. They should complete your style and we want to play an active role in this process and help you create the desired image.Our designs are unique and specially created for you based on face anatomy research and current trends so that you can look and feel perfect all the time.The story of our design started in Morez (Jura Valley) considered the Silicon Valley of glasses, moved to Lille, France – Euratechnologies (Startups Incubator), Lance was founded to set your mind free from the endless search for overpriced glasses and help you focus on the things that really matter! We’ve teamed up with world class designers and high-tech manufacturers to craft above standard, strong, lightweight frames with high standard lenses, at a price that you’ll definitely find interesting. We have succeeded in combining modern Parisian designs inspired by current trends with French culture and tradition. It has al begun in 1796 in Les Arcets, a hamlet in Morez where Pierre-Hyacinthe Caseaux, an ingenious craftsman, had the idea of stretching and twisting a nail to make spectacles.While we manufacture our frames to the highest standard of quality.If you feel that the frame did not meet your expectations, simply contact us and we will replace the frame. Does that sound fair? :-) Then you should hurry up and reserve your eyewear. During the first campaign, many people asked us about our process. We do everything in the house and we want to make sunglasses and eyeglasses that do not weigh you down. That's why we started this in the first place. Our process begins with mood boards, shapes, colours, research and story made by our product developer and art director, Liviu. Our designer, Luc, creates the first sketches and drawings and the process continues with our engineer, Karim and our production manager, Gonzague, that manage the entire production from searching suppliers, making prototypes, quality checks and production planning to sending the glasses to their new owners.Once the campaign ends, you will be able to try the new virtual mirror that now works also from your smartphone so you can be sure that you’re make the best choice! Finding the right frame style for your face shape might feel tricky, but thankfully our app helps you pick the right frame and it is so easy.We want to offer you the possibility to match your frames to your style and the occasions you enjoy so we designed quality frames at a fair price. We’re not just for show. We strongly believe that a good design isn’t only about looking good. Seeing good is also a must. Lance enables you to have the best option without stressful research on lenses coatings. Our team, along with the best opticians, have selected and implemented the best for you.  Using the most advanced optical software and industry-leading machinery, Lance can handle the most complicated corections with an extraordinary level of accuracy and optical clarity, including digital free-form lenses. All of our lenses are maximum UV-protection and provide a 100% filter from harmful UVA, UVB and UVC rays including the blue light from digital screens. The invisible coatings make your glasses your best daily ally adapting to any situation. At the end of each month, we will send you a survey so you can choose your favourite model, colour and whether you need prescription lenses or not.We remove all the intermediaries and offer luxury glasses, three times cheaper than the store pricing. Our engineer and co-founder, Karim Bousbaine, has optimized and simplified processes and the management for the largest multinationals all over the world. He has used the experience gained in the last 15 years in the Lance Glasses fabrication process and so we have made this price possible, enabling us to offer you Luxury Limited Edition eyeglasses for less than 100€. Check some of the feedback that our previous happy customers shared on our site.Over the past year, we have developed our new Lance collection, improving and testing multiple prototypes until reaching perfection. Based in Lille, France, our team comes from different horizons, making our company’s vision richer. Our philosophy is deliciously simple. We produce a luxury product meeting the standards of the best brands on the market at an honest price.Glasses Model: Haussmann Ace & Steel / Color : Shiny Palladium & Glossy Black AcetateGlasses Model: Haussmann Ace & Steel / Color: Gold Green TransparentGlasses Model: Haussmann Classic / Color: Matte Green Transparent and Matte TransparentGlasses Model: Opera / Color: Matte Green Transparent and Matte TransparentGlasses Model: Opera / Color: Matte Green Transparent and Matte TransparentGlasses Model: Haussmann Smart Metal / Color: Matte Palladium - Glasses Model: Haussmann Ace&Steel / Color : Matte Green TransparentGlasses Model: Steve Smart Metal / Color: GoldGlasses Model: Steve Smart Metal / Color: Matte PalladiumGlasses Model: Haussmann Ace & Steel / Color: Shiny Gold & Green Matte Transparent

story:
We've also been featured on : Carryology, Bless This Stuff, Best Leather, Urban Daddy, Manners.nl, Pf.nl, Muted, Gigamen, What My Boyfriend Wore,  and Filtromag.

Alpha 13/Dark

If this is the first time you've heard of us, you might be wondering why should I back these guys. Well, aside from getting your hands on some excellent leather goods, you should also know that you'll be in good hands. 

Communication. We'll be here for you. There won't be radio silence from us. 

Experience. We know how to run a crowdfunding project, from start to end. Managing logistics, production, shipping, etc. You name it, we've done it..and rather well I might add. :)

Service. We aim to take good care of our backers. Check out our previous projects' comments at Kickstarter and you'll see how we do things, handle concerns and respond to questions. 

Delivery. We've shipped on time, and , fingers crossed, we'll do so again this time around. Oh, and to make things easier for everyone, free worldwide shipping is included with all rewards.

Quality. Ok by this point we hope we've convinced you that we know our crowdfunding stuff. But are the bags any good? To answer that, you can read some reviews from backers, customers and medias here. All reviews are linked to their source for credibility.

F.C. 15/Brown

This is it. The collection we will launch with your help. Some are old favorites, tweaked and improved, the rest are new ones based on backers' suggestions. We've been working on this collection for a few months now, testing and refining them as we go along.  As a summary, this project features :  

  • Alpha series - briefcase in 13 & 15 size.
  • C.O. series - laptop bag in 15 size.
  • F.C. series - messenger bag in 10, 13 & 15 size.
  • Slim F.C. - slimmer version of the F.C. in 13 & 15 size.
  • Denim F.C. - the F.C. design in handwoven denim, in 13 & 15 size.
  • Fabric F.C. - the F.C. design in durable Sunbrella fabric, in 13 & 15 size.
  • The leather bags come in 2 colors, Dark & Brown, while the non leather bag will be finished with Dark leather. 
  • The number after the bag's name : 15 means it can fit a 15" laptop, 13 a 13" laptop and 10 a 9.7" iPad or similar sized tablet. 

Slim F.C. 15/Brown

One of the general features of our bags is being able to be mounted  on a suitcase (except for the F.C. 10). You will be able to do this either by using the handles (C.O. series), the grab handle (F.C. series) or by using a bonus leather strap we'll include for the Alpha series. 

All bags except the F.C. 10 can be mounted on a suitcase. In this photo F.C. 15/Dark

Each Alpha bag will come with one of these bonus straps that you can slip through the top handle's rings, enabling you to mount your Alpha bag on a suitcase.

Each bag comes with one of these bonus Sunbrella pouch to organize your stuff.

We've included a lot of images in the gallery, if you want to see more they're available here.

Our signature series, it's our take on the classic briefcase design. Rugged, durable and practical. They are lined with Sunbrella, a very durable and weather proof fabric and comes with a bonus small leather strap to attach the bag to a suitcase.

Our version of the classic field messenger bags, ready to take on all the adventures you throw at them. 

The C.O. series is our solution for a great laptop bag. Elegant with a dash of ruggedness thrown in.

All the good things about the F.C. series in a slimmer form and lighter weight. A simple and durable utilitarian bag for your essentials.

We team up with the guys at Lumintu (more info on them is available in "Materials" section of this project) to present you the F.C. series in handwoven denim exterior. Completing the look are leather trims, base and straps in Dark. 

In contrast with the traditional materials for the F.C. and the Denim F.C., here we use the modern Sunbrella fabric for both the exterior and the interior of the bag.  The outer for this series will be in black, the lining will be the same red with black stripes like the other lined bags. Like the Denim F.C.s, the leather trims, straps and base will be in Dark. This series is the lightest one in the whole F.C. collection.

Make your bags more personal by adding your initials ! Max 3 upper case letters, Roman alphabet, letters only, we can't do numbers or punctuation. The letters are 8mm tall. 

You can choose between two award winning fonts from Monokrom Font Foundry. Telefon for a modern clean look or Satyr for a more classic feel. For this project, the (optional) initials personalization is free! We'll contact you to ask for your initials details. 

Note : For Denim & Fabric F.C. 13 & 15 we'll add a small leather patch to stamp your initials or custom design and stitch it onto the front flap of the bag for no additional cost. 

  • Full Grain Vegetable Tanned Leather 

First, to clear up any confusion vegetable tanned leather does not mean that we use vegan/imitation/synthetic leather, it refers to how we process/tan the leather we use. Vegetable tanning uses natural tannins found in some plant species to tan the leather. In all our goods, we use real full grain vegetable tanned leather.

Downsides to vegetable tanned leather : 

  • Takes a long time to finish (about two months in our case) 
  • Harder to find tanneries with workers skilled in it 
  • Higher cost in general, but well worth it! 

Upsides : 

  • Vegetable tanned leather have a more organic look with beautiful natural grains; It’s not uniformed, the irregularity gives the leather a unique aesthetic 
  • It’s strong and durable 
  • It will change over time, growing softer and darker, acquiring a nice patina as it ages, making each bag unique. 

Alpha 15/Brown

Full grain means that our leather comes from the strongest and most durable layer of the hide that has all of the grain. Our leather is not sanded down to take away its surface imperfections. Rather, we prefer its natural look and feel, with its markings and grain characteristics.

F.C. 15/Dark

We've worked a long time now with our leather tannery partner and the collaboration has been incredible. In this project you'll be able to choose between Brown, Dark or Black for your leather bags, while the Denim & Fabric F.C. bags will be finished with Dark leather. 

Note : Black was a late addition to our Kickstarter, at this point there are no sample products/photos yet. Basically the color will be solid Black, no lighter/darker spots like the Dark & Brown seen on the photos in this project page. 

  • Handwoven Denim

We will be using one of the denim fabric produced by Lumintu.  Like us, their production is based in Indonesia. They are a small company based in Pekalongan, Indonesia, producing beautiful denim using time honored traditional techniques that you can see here. The Indonesian denim scene is very vibrant and we're very excited to be able to do this collaboration. The denim outer, Sunbrella lining and the leather details in the Denim F.C. series work really well together and we hope you'll agree. :)

Denim F.C. 13

 

  • Sunbrella

We have been using Sunbrella to line our bags and for the bonus pouch for some time now and it has been very well received. It is made from acrylic and is extremely durable with great water repellent properties. The lining we choose has a base red color with black stripes. It's quite a striking color but not overwhelmingly so. We think it adds a bit more personality to the collection. Note : depending on your screen, the images might not display the small black stripes, but they're there.

Fabric F.C. 15

 

  • Solid Brass Accessories 

Another suppliers we've worked together for quite some time. The solid brass accessories are handmade by Sotta Art of Jogjakarta, Indonesia, while the rivets are sourced from Buckleguy from the US. They are awesome people to work with and deliver high quality goods.

All leather goods will be made in house in our own workshop in Jakarta, Indonesia. With successful crowdfunding projects on our belt plus a few experiences handling large volume B2B orders, our team is prepared to craft your rewards.

Our timeline is as follows :

  • July - conclusion of our Kickstarter campaign and start of supplier delivery
  • August - final supplier delivery, continue production.
  • September - continue production.
  • October - goods inspection, packing. First batch of shipping begins.

C.O. 15/Dark

The Team :

  • Yoki P. Baskara - Designer, product developer and the guy who will communicate with  you throughout this project.
  • Rama Luhur - A former manager at a multinational shipping company. He manages the logistics side, and will make sure the rewards arrive safely.
  • Vega Vashtiary - Yoki’s sparring partner in designing.

Two of the founder, Yoki & Rama with older version of the F.C. 15 & Alpha 15.

Alpha 13/Brown

You made it to the end! Thank you for checking out this project, for your support and for being part of our journey! 

Alpha 13/Dark

Risks and challenges

Given that we produce the goods in house. The biggest challenge is getting the materials on time.

Supplies, Leather :

Fortunately we are on great terms with him and we can put the order in advance. 

Color accuracy : 
Displaying accurate colors on all possible screens is very hard. That being said we've tried our best to make sure the photos properly represent the actual leather's colors.

Alpha 13/Dark

FAQ

How will we inform the choice of colors, font & initials?

We'll contact you to get all the necessary details. 

Do you guys offer warranty?

The same warranty policy that applies on our website applies here. If you're having problem, let us know and we'll take care of it. We can either replace, repair or if you don't want to be separated with your Cravar goods for too long, you can get it repaired locally and we'll reimburse the cost through PayPal.

How tall are the models in your video ?

Right, the two guys in he video and photos are Yoki and Rama, two of the founders. Here's the breakdown :

Rama : 5'9"/175cm, he's wearing terracota & blue window pane blazers, maroon jumper and white short sleeve shirt.

Yoki : 6'/183cm, he's wearing Navy, Cream & Brown blazers and Chambray shirt.

Are there internal pockets in the F.C. family?

No, as stated in the project page, all the F.C.s (including Slim, Denim & Fabric) has one big main compartment and aside from the slim, front & back pocket(s). There's no inside divider, so that we can maximize their capacity.

Slim F.C. 15/Brown

story:
Thanks for checking out Sash Bag's third Kickstarter campaign, Sash Bag 3.0: Reversible Sash Bags! If you're new to Sash, get ready to fall madly in love. Sash Bags are literally life changing. What is it that makes a Sash so special? It's the way the bag is designed ergonomically to organize all of your daily necessities without weighing you down. You know those moments when you really don't want to carry a purse, but you still magically want all your stuff handy? That's where Sash Bags come in. Check it out...

 

You have helped us bring two projects to life already. The first was for a cloth version of the Sash Bag. The second was for an expandable line of Sash Bags. This campaign is all about the color!! Sash Bag 3.0 has the following features:

REVERSIBLE: It's a reversible design so you can choose your front color and back color and wear them interchangeably. You are essentially getting two bags in one!!

LARGER: The size is 3/4 of an inch wider. So it's right in between the Classic and Extra size (from our last campaign) to give you just a smidge of extra wiggle room!

CONVENIENT: The exterior pockets on front and back are open slip pockets to make the bag truly reversible.

SECURE: The strap was redesigned to remove the D-ring and snap into itself, proving extra security and eliminating folds that kept the bags reversibility limited.

Now the fun part!!

Wanna see your color options? We are starting with the basics once we raise our minimum of $39,000 and then unlocking colors along the way with a series of stretch goals! Check out our goals and help us unlock each level by pledging and sharing the campaign with your friends! Here are the goals: 

Which colors are your favorites? We'd love to hear. We sent out surveys earlier this year to see what colors y'all were most interested in and excited about. That's how we landed on these pallets. We also try to keep in mind that the colors need to be versatile. Having a reversible bag makes the versatility easier since you can have two colors in one and just flip it to mix it up depending on what you're wearing! 

There are a total of 12 colors, which makes 144 different combination options to mix and match. These are just some ideas of our favorites. And can we please talk about the leather distressing? In this campaign, all of our leather is treated with a marbling effect to give it that dimension and depth that was so popular in the calico and honey of the previous campaign.

The rest of the stretch goals and designs are not included in the mix/match portion of the campaign. Why? Well, it's kind of a long story, but if you are at all familiar with our last campaign you will remember that it got a little out of hand with the customizations (but how fun was that??) and this time around we need to limit ourselves on the number of options we offer so that, you know... It doesn't take over a year to fulfill! 

So, with all of that said, the following combinations are intended to offer some variety to your pledges, but are confined to the set designs we lay out below. The first is the ikat/cloth option that adds a little somethin' somethin' for those who are not interested in leather.

The ikat/leather combinations add an option for those who want leather but maybe don't have the budget for a full leather -- or hey! Maybe you just really really love the ikat and want to combine your two loves: ikat and leather. And if that's you, we should be friends because that's also us! 

 You might be wondering what ikat fabric is all about. If so, we would love to tell you more!! Here's a little cut and paste from Wikipedia: 

"Ikat is a dyeing technique used to pattern textiles that employs resist dyeing on the yarns prior to dyeing and weaving the fabric. In ikat the resist is formed by binding individual yarns or bundles of yarns with a tight wrapping applied in the desired pattern (ikat means "to bind" in the Indonesian language)."

Ikat is a very special fabric to us. Our founder has spent a lot of time in Indonesia and India working with ikat mills, to source and produce the best prints for the Sash bag line. Here are a few photos taken by Nichole on some of her trips to the mill in India:

The next stretch goal is another pre-set combination... This time of metallic leathers!!

Got your bags picked out? We can't wait to hear what you are going to create! Eeek!! 

We also added some cute accessories to the campaign that will make organizing your Sash bag even easier. We will announce more colors as the campaign grows, but here's a snapshot of what the accessories will be, including a round coin case, a sunglasses case, and a luggage tag, all made from genuine leather:

That's right! Organizing your Sash just got even better. You can add an accessories set (of three items) to your pledge for $45. 

Now meet the team that is going to make it all happen!

Gotta love the Sash Team!! Our customer service scores are off the charts, thanks to these hard working, fun, smart, amazing crew. They're what good companies are made of. Seriously, each of these beautiful souls shows up to work every day with a can-do attitude, a genuine passion for making customers happy, and that do-whatever-it-takes effort to make sure things are running smoothly. Thanks, Sash Team!!

Hey, it's not every day that you are named one of San Diego's People of the Year. Our Chief Bag Lady, Nichole MacDonald, has shaken things up in the entrepreneur community in San Diego. She has grown the Sash business from scratch, throwing conventional wisdom out the window and creating a strategy all her own, driven by authenticity and building community. But she's not just the face of Sash. She is the designer, the CEO, and fearless leader of the Sash Sisterhood.

We love, love, LOVE our customers and can't emphasize enough that we WOULD NOT HAVE A BUSINESS WITHOUT THEM. That's why they are number one, always. Our philosophy is to treat each customer the way we would treat our friends, because we genuinely view our customers as friends and are infinitely grateful for the support.

As a little "Thank You", we are offering a free shirt to the first 500 backers on this campaign who pledge for a bag!

Ready to join the Sash Squad? Here's the down low. First, pick your reward level. Below is an estimated timeline of delivery. Once the campaign ends in September, give us a couple of weeks to get the surveys built. That'll give you time to decide what you want, what you really, really want. You'll have another week or so to submit your choices. We'll start production in October, and we're estimating that we'll start delivering bags in April, 2020. 

Disclaimer of the century: We do not know how many bags we will sell in this campaign. Our last campaign was over 10,000 bags and wound up taking about a year to get the last stragglers of bags delivered. It was also a much more complicated campaign (which we will never, ever do again -- phew!). But we can reasonably estimate that up to 3,000-4,000 bags can be delivered around April 2020 and if it goes over that, it might take longer. We say might because this production is expected to be much smoother, so we don't anticipate the same delays. BUT WHO KNOWS?? ?Gotta put all the disclaimers in there about the timeline. Okay, we're done now. Here's a snapshot:

If you're new to Sash and want a bag, like, today... You can also shop directly on our website at www.thesashbag.com. Thanks for checking out the Sash 3.0 Kickstarter campaign. We are always here to answer any questions you have. We look forward to hearing from you and being on this adventure together!! xoxo
story_txt:

story:
Pride rides deep in the Caldwell family!  We did not wear the hottest sneakers or the latest fashions, that didn’t matter. We were taught to walk tall, be respectful, do our best and be our best because we were the Caldwells.  Athleticism as well as academics was stressed in our home and we certainly excelled in both areas.

As was the norm, on the weekends and during the summer breaks, we (Dion, myself and the Clanton Park crew) perused all the local parks like, Freedom, Latta, Park Road, Southside and Brookhill. It was normal for us to walk up, wait and NOT be chosen to run with the person who had “next”.  With clean t-shirts, plaid shorts and whatever no-name-brand shoes our parents could afford, we were always overlooked.  Appearance is certainly not indicative of the basketball talent and skills that we possessed and soon everyone knew that. 

Once we hit the court, we dominated the court. When we yelled “game”, that’s when the trash talking would begin.  Attractive wear doesn’t give you game.  Heart, mental focus, killer instincts, and practice, practice, practice develops you into a winner.  Our attitude was, you may afford sports attire that looks better, but you can’t out play us.

From our dominance on the courts and our genuine love of sports in general, we became a household name. The backyard at the Caldwells was the cool-aid hangout house with cars parked up and down Manchester Drive.  Our popularity of being “trash talkers” was as well known as our athleticism and academics.  Family and friends could quote our trash talking lines.  We began to write them down. 

Fast forward; college, military didn’t dull our senses for trash talking nor dull our love for the game.  We decided to put our trademark quotes and trash talking lines on t-shirts, thus, Hazzardous Sports Gear was born. Why??  trash talking 'T-shirts" only WINNERS!! talk trash.  So common and be a WINNER and help our campaign> thank you with a 2 BROTHERS 1 MIND SMILE!

story:
Bull & Stash started with an idea about ideas.

For thinkers and creatives, notebooks are a must. But once they’re full, they end up on a dusty shelf and we have to start over with something new. You’ve got to look around, do a little speed dating in the notebook aisle—it’s hard to find the one. What if you never had to start over in the first place?

Here’s the idea: create a notebook that lasts forever and never runs out of paper. This is it. Beautiful leather binding, carefully selected paper, and a simple design that allows you to replace the pages when they’re full.

For whatever adventures, projects and stories lie ahead of you, we made a notebook that you can take every step of the way.


Thick oiled leather cover: Beautiful, durable oiled leather will protect your notes and weather beautifully over time; the more you use it, the more it becomes yours.

Metal hardware:  We use sturdy Chicago screws so your pages aren’t going anywhere. When you’re ready to replace your pages, an easy hand twist is all you need.

Quality paper:  Choose the paper that best meets your creative needs. Whether it’s lined paper or thick sketch paper, we’ve made careful selections to give you the best quality, #60 paper. 

Bull & Stash leather notebooks come in Brown...

...And in Black...

...And they will add joy & style to your daily note taking like no other notebook can.






Organize your thoughts: We chose to use loose leaf paper in all of our notebooks, meaning you can take out your pages of notes, spread all your thoughts in front of you at once, and then organize them according to your preference. No more flipping through pages trying to find where you wrote that important note.


Paper types: We’ve put a lot of thought into our paper types. Whether you need lined, grid, or a light dot-grid, we’ve got you covered. In the future, we’ve got our eyes on recycled and extra thick drawing paper, too. A refillable notebook means you never have to settle for less than the perfect match.


Stash your genius: When it’s time to swap paper out, simply unscrew the Chicago screws, lift out your notes, and replace them with fresh paper. Put your most treasured sketches on display or spread out your notes to take it all in—with a Bull & Stash notebook, archiving your genius is easy.

We’ve designed a durable, beautiful product to last a lifetime; this kind of craftsmanship has its costs. With your support we will be able to invest in more paper options for the future of your Bull & Stash notebook.

Here are a few we have on the drawing board...

After the campaign ends, we will offer a selection of these new paper types as refills, available as add-ons to whichever perk you have supported us for.

It’s the help of our supporters that has brought us this far and to say thank you, we add every one of them to “Our Stash” at bullandstash.com. Once you receive your notebook, the perks are sure to continue with your Bull & Stash notebook.


Whether your notebook becomes a hiking companion, sketchpad, or life organizing tool, different sizes and formats meet different needs. Choose from an array of carefully designed options to find your perfect match.




In order to hit our tight turn around and ship date of January, we're going to need some help from you guys! As soon as our campaign ends, we'll send you a survey to fill out telling us what color of leather you would like, and what paper type. For our holiday perk supporters this is even more important! Holiday Perk supporters must answer their survey before 12/9/2015 to have guaranteed delivery before 12/23/2015 (USA addresses only)

December 2nd: End of campaign! (Surveys will be sent out same day)

December 2nd - 11th: Make all Holiday Perks

December 14th: Deliver Holiday Perk Notebooks to fulfillment house & ship!

December 15th - January 15th: Make all other Perk level orders

January 20th: Deliver Notebooks to fulfillment house & ship!


We have worked hard behind the scenes to make this company a success. With smart design we’ve made assembly simple and materials accessible; our suppliers are ready for the next steps and we are too.

We know that some challenges cannot be predicted, so we have established multiple back-ups for every step of production and distribution. Whether a crucial machine malfunctions or inclement weather delays a shipment, we are prepared to work around any obstacles that may come and carry on with minimal delay.

If there is a delay in the reward process for any reason, earnest, open communication with our Indiegogo supporters is our number one priority. Your support has brought our dreams to life; we’ll get your notebooks to you as soon as possible so that you can fill them with your dreams, too.

story:
Technology: What makes knit denim different?

Denim has been historically produced from yarn-dyed spun yarns of cotton or combinations of cotton and synthetic blend spun yarns, which have been woven together to provide a fabric with a generally uniform appearance. These woven fabrics have very little stretch naturally, because of their uniform weave and when stretch materials are blended in they typically result in a weaker overall fabric. This is why most woven denim brands limit the amount of stretch added, since there is a direct tradeoff. Essentially your 3% spandex stretch pants are a marketing ploy.

Knit denim is different from woven denim in a few ways. It’s made by dyeing yarn, knitting the dyed-yarn into a foundation layer and front layer, and then tightening the front layer with a tensile force greater than a tensile force on the foundation layer. From there the denim is washed to remove residual dyes. By knitting the yarn to compose the denim, the denim takes on characteristics of a sort of brushed terry cloth type softness, random knotting similar to regular denim, and even twilling patterns. The easiest way to explain it is knit denim is like a chain link fence, and wovens are more like a dense lattice.

Technical Advantages of knit denim:

Knit fabrics are usually soft and drape well meaning they look better on a variety of different body types. Thicker fabrics compared to woven fabric which are usually thinner and without the typical breathability tradeoffs of thickness. Greater wrinkle resistance. It’s ability to stretch is naturally greater due to the open knit construction.  

 

The ALDAY DENIM TEST LAB

Watch what happens when we drop a bowling ball onto our denim from 6 feet up.

 

What’s our background?

Ryan and Danny have worked together in the apparel business for 7 years. Danny is 4th generation in the apparel business. His family started off in high-end menswear, and now has taken his family’s apparel expertise to the young mens contemporary market. He’s been the Brand Manager of the California Lifestyle Brand, Ezekiel for the past 6 years. 

He’s worked closely with some retailers to develop exclusive private-label programs. Danny is also the Co-Owner of 3Point Distribution, a business manager for the apparel industry specializing in operating brands from: shipping, sourcing, production, and designing. In his role as Director of Marketing at Ezekiel Ryan oversaw global marketing campaigns and content production worldwide. 

As a trained photographer Ryan leads both creative and technical marketing efforts. He has consulted and built out many ecommerce programs with brands underneath 3Point Distribution. His work leading teams to unify customer service with complex backend services has provided a unique technical edge for 3Point's mid-size clothing brands ecommerce programs.

Why are we doing this?

"We believe that things are way too complicated for guys. We need denim that can roll with us wherever we go, but when Danny and I looked for something that ticked those boxes we were barraged with tons of brands trying to sell people expensive denim that says stretch but actually feels like a straightjacket made from a burlap bag. We couldn't find a pair of denim that was both comfortable and and still looked great, so we decided to create the most comfortable denim ourselves. 

After working in the industry for years we knew that this was only possible if you throw out the playbook, cut the phoney designer marketing games, and deliver a technically superior product directly to customers. No middlemen taking their cuts, just the best possible denim at the best possible price.  What we created is a pair of denim that’s so damn comfortable that we think you’ll want to live in it.” 

-Ryan & Danny

Follow along with ALDAY DENIM:

Our Open-Knit fabric allows for so much flexibility that our fit feels like a regular straight-slim fit, but with a subtle taper allowing you to go dress up or dress down no matter where your day takes you.

He has consulted and built out many ecommerce programs with brands underneath 3Point Distribution. His work leading teams to unify customer service with complex backend services has provided a unique technical edge for 3Point's mid-size clothing brands ecommerce programs.Why are we doing this?"We believe that things are way too complicated for guys. We need denim that can roll with us wherever we go, but when Danny and I looked for something that ticked those boxes we were barraged with tons of brands trying to sell people expensive denim that says stretch but actually feels like a straightjacket made from a burlap bag. We couldn't find a pair of denim that was both comfortable and and still looked great, so we decided to create the most comfortable denim ourselves. After working in the industry for years we knew that this was only possible if you throw out the playbook, cut the phoney designer marketing games, and deliver a technically superior product directly to customers. No middlemen taking their cuts, just the best possible denim at the best possible price.  What we created is a pair of denim that’s so damn comfortable that we think you’ll want to live in it.” -Ryan & Danny Follow along with ALDAY DENIM:     
 
FAQs

SuperFiber / 300%Comfortable

A SuperFiber is synthetic fibre that is made of several different materials, fabrics in various combinations. SuperFiber fabrics are highly versatile and popular for a wide variety of uses. this fabric has become a popular choice for performance apparel and sports wear. It is fast replacing cotton fabrics in production of these speciality clothings.

  • Dries quickly and can be washable.

  • Shiny surface.

  • Non-sweat absorbent.

  • Sticky & warm feeling.

Auto Temperature Adjust Hot/Cool ECO Performance Fabric

It is SuperFiber’s type of fabric with Superior moisture management system and UV PROTECTION (Protecting your skin and health), As SuperFiber wicks moisture away from the body, it keeps the wearer cool, dry and comfortable feeling. As such, it has come to occupy an important position in the category of moisture management fabrics. The easy care advantage keeps garments of Anto Temperature Adjust Hot/Cool® fresh and looking new wash after wash. The unique fiber construction provides extra stretch performance. As this fabric is liquid and stain resistant, it is ideal for office wear even in rainy season.

  • Helps to block the majority of UVuto rays.

  • Provides a UPF of 50.

  • eeps fabric soft and breathable.

  • Durable effect.


Scientists have proven that overheating and exhaustion are the top reasons for decreased performance when performing physical activities. Basically we overheat, get tired and are no longer motivated to work. With our exclusive technology you can now stay Temperature, longer. 

Testing

Our special fabric was tested at the worlds most prestigious testing facility in Germany. Tested against the top 5 leading performance apparel brands in the world (Nike, Under Armour, Puma, Adidas and Northface) for fabric cooling, moisture wicking and other abilities, we beat them in every category. It's as simple as that. 


The World's First Self auto Temperature Adjust Hot/Cooling SuperFiber PoloShirt.You are now the proud owner of the most advanced performance shirt or tank in the world.we spent months perfecting our patterns to hug you .Pick your color (Red,Blue,Pink,Navy,White,Black,Maroon and more)

story:
Help us make this happen, contribute to PenHead now!

Our sincerest gratitude to our contributors so far! Thank you guys, your help in bringing us closer to being able to do what we love is greatly appreciated. Every small step counts and adds up to a great distance to go. Help us bring our talent and ultimately the talents of many others to everyone!

 

THESE ARE ONLY THE FIRST FOUR!! (Scroll down to see the original 15 Limited Edition Designs) Over the course of the next few days, we will release 21 BRAND NEW Designs! Make sure to check back daily to see what surprises the PenHead Crowd has for you.

 These designs will look great on any item of your choice. Be sure to follow us on Instagram @penheaddesigns – in there you will find samples of these delightful designs on various items.  

 


 


WIN-WIN Situation! Support our campaign by liking or sharing on Facebook or Twitter by clicking on their buttons on this page, and get a FREE T-SHIRT! Why? Don't ask, just do it! Remember, your referrals MUST visit and donate at our campaign page, using the url www.igg.me/at/penhead



We want to create a source of affordable and unique clothing and accessories designs, where you get to provide the core concept for the artist to design your items, and you customize your item to your own taste.
Every shirt, hoodie, tank top or phone case will be uniquely created for you to wear; each and every design will be unrepeatable!



Not quite! This is a project related to art & artists, in a fashion market. What makes us unique is:

  • We want to provide a one-of-a-kind service where each and every customer gets their own unique and unrepeatable design in a fun, interactive and affordable experience.
  • We seek to become a job source for independent, talented people who wish to start a career in this path by gaining clothing design experience.
  • We are not a group of renowned artists; we are starters just like you, who would love to turn our passion into our living, and be able to bring more dreamers to join us!


Simple: we want this to be an interactive and fun experience where both parts contribute to the creation: 



SHIPPING: PenHead offers standard ground shipping for FREE in the USA & Canada. Shipping outside the USA & Canada is only available to Mexico during our IndieGoGo campaign, for a small additional shipping fee.  



 


We want to be an AFFORDABLE source of UNIQUE and UNREPEATABLE clothing and accessories designs with the best quality, where you get to provide the core concept for the artist to design your items. 

We seek to become a job source for independent, talented people who wish to start a career in this path by gaining their initial clothing design experiences.

We have seen many artists show their work on their Facebook, Instagram, blogs, or many other sites. It would be great if more people could get to witness their talent – or better yet, get to WEAR their talent!

 

Right now, we are only a team of three people who love drawing, sketching and designing. With your help, we can make this bigger and move our operations to an independent website, where we can serve as a platform for talented people to work on unique, authentic and unrepeatable designs for each and every customer’s clothes and accessories. 

With your contribution, we can invest in the following:

  • Buying a scanner! Right now we have been borrowing a scanner, or going to places where we can scan our designs for a small fee. 
  • Independent website creation by vendor or freelancers – jobs for others
  • Mobile version of website or an app – more jobs for others
  • Scaling up the demand so we can involve more artists – more jobs for others!
  • Material & Software for our artists – more professional designing 
  • Local & web training for our artists to continue growing and developing
  • Budget for further operations
  • Backing other projects! We will definitely use a generous amount of the contributions we receive to contribute ourselves on other projects.



With this campaign, we want people to get to know us and our special art product. We want you to wear our art and help us spread the word so our concept can grow and become a stable job source for us and others.

For this launch and first batch, we have set $10,000.00 as our initial goal:






PERKS CUSTOMIZATION: Customization and personalization is our main driver.

We want you to be able to customize and personalize your perks, regardless of which one you choose when contributing! For example, if you select a $99 Perk, you don’t have to necessarily get the three PenHead shirts, you could also get:

       a.  A $55 Perk and a 35 Perk – A Phone Case and a Shirt, or
       b.  A $55 Perk and a $35 PenHead Custom Design

Even if you have to select one Perk only when contributing, we will get in touch with you and sort this out together, so you can get what you want.

Bottom Line is, you can mix and match what you want with whatever you can cover with your contribution!

PERKS AUTOGRAPHS: Any perk you choose can be optionally signed and dedicated by us!
















We also already have 15 Limited Edition designs for you to be placed in an item of your choice – they will only be given out for the duration of our project in Indiegogo. They can also be autographed or dedicated to you if you wish.

These existing designs are a great way to help us!


 

 



Please contact us at penheaddesigns@gmail.com


Thank you all for your support and contributions, we are really excited and optimistic about this project!



1.  Our main challenge is being able to spread the word and putting our project out there. We would really appreciate your help in this – tell your friends about us, mention us in your social media, etc.

2.  The most obvious risk is that the project doesn’t take off or gather enough funds.

3.  Another risk is having the project be EXTREMELY successful and facing a lot of demand. This risk, however, will be mitigated by immediately bringing more artists on-board to be able to meet demand.

story:
UPDATE :: 31 July 2015


During the past two months, and especially during Ramadan, we took a break from the workshops for the trainees to spend more time with their families and to observe the Holy Month. At the same time, the INAASH office has been under renovation, and I have been in London working on my MA and preparing for my imminent return to Beirut to resume the second phase of the project. We are now all looking forward to reactivating the training at the beginning of/mid August.

There are 14 trainees from four different Palestinian Refugee Camps in Lebanon, all of whom have shown great commitment and accomplishment. To date, these participants have mastered thirteen of the fifteen stitches. They are already producing samples and prototypes to be incorporated into the INAASH itinerary of products. .

Thanks to your generous contributions, support, and shares we managed to raise more than $12,000.00 (twelve thousand United States Dollars) through the indiegogo on-line crowd funding website, and direct contributions.

We are currently working on reviewing our budget, including calculating the final total raised taking into account the exchange rates on different currencies. This will be publicly accessible by the beginning of next month, including a list of the direct contributions and contributors, and other information and exciting updates as well as our future plans. We will make sure to write you and bring all of this to your attention.

Please do not hesitate to contact this page, myself or INAASH if you have any questions or suggestions. This project would not have been possible without you – THANK YOU!



PROJECT UPDATES

Since the start of the project, we have been able to teach 13 out of 15 stitches to the participants. We are now on a short break for Ramadan and will resume the training mid July. The latter part of the training will concentrate on the development of the Embroiderer's skills their mastery of stitches and the learning of the last remaining two stitches.


The embroiderers and the designer visiting Malak Abdulrahim Husseini at her house in Beirut to see a collection of Old Palestinian Dresses as part of the training.


PROJECT SUMMARY

FIFTEEN STITCHES (May-August 2015)

The ultimate aim of this project is to increase the income and skills of Palestinian Refugee embroiderers, the majority of whom are women, working with the Association for the development of Palestinian Camps in Lebanon (INAASH).

Through a workshop introducing them to 15 new historic Palestinian embroidery techniques to expand their creativity, skills and techniques to produce new and original work.

The goal is to expand the embroiderers market and therefore increase their income. This will also re-introduce to the Palestinian community in Lebanon to techniques which have been seldom used or developed in and outside of Palestine. It will help keep the stitches, some of which are hundreds of years old, relevant and ensure their daily use amongst Palestinians wherever they are.

The embroiderers come from different refugee camps around Lebanon, namely Mar Elias, Rashidiieh, Burj El Shamali, Saida, Baalbeck.

By supporting this project you will be helping:

  • Raise the income of embroiders by developing their skills and increasing the variety of their products
  • Develop and refine the work of Palestinian embroiderers in refugee camps in Lebanon
  • Expand INAASH’s library of stiches and embroidery techniques
  • Ensure the continuity of Palestinian historical traditions of dressmaking and embroidery
  • Promote the variety and creativity of Palestinian embroidery and dressmaking

To date no collective, organisation, or charity engaged in Palestinian embroidery both in and outside of Palestine uses more than 7 embroidery techniques at the most. With their original mastery of cross-stitch, herringbone stitch, patchwork and bar stain stitch INAASH’s embroiderers will be one of the first to work and eventually master at least 18 different stitches from all over Palestine.

The workshop will be organised and run by Palestinian designer, OmarJoseph Nasser-Khoury. He has been working with INAASH and several other Palestinian organisations in Palestine since 2009 on to expanding the understanding of Palestinian dress and its relevance as a dynamic design practice.


THE FIFTEEN STITCHES:

Details from Bethlehem Dress Chest Panel - Photo by Omarivs Ioseph Filivs Dinæ ©The British Museum MMXV


Manajel : Functional and decorative connecting stitches used instead of sewing to connect pieces of fabric together in dressmaking

·  Regular Block Connecting Stitch (Manajal Adi)

·  Knotted Block Connecting Stitch (Manjal Ugedde)

·  Zigzag Connecting Stitch (Manajal Halâl)

·  Knotted Zigzag Connecting Stitch (Manjal Halâl Ugedde)

·  Majdal/Gaza Connecting Stitch (Manjal Majdalawi)


Habke : Functional and decorative hemming stitches used to finish garments

·  Herringbone Hemming Stitch (Habke)

·  Majdal/Gazan Double Buttonhole Hemming Stitch (Habke Majdalawieh)


Decorative Stitches : Used as surface decoration to embellish and enhance garments and were also used to communicate certain social and geographic specifies throughout Palestine

·  Stem Stitch (Gma’a)

·  Chain Stitch (ghaban)

·  Filling Satin Stitch (Tehshai)

·  Buttonhole Wheels (Takhreem)

·  Feather Stitch (Reeshe)

· Braid Stitch (Jadle)

·  Bethlehem and Beit Dajan Couching Stitch (Tahriri)


Tinbeeteh : Fine functional and decorative running/tacking stitch used to fix layers of fabric together unique to Galilee and so far no other examples found

·  Galilee Triplet Running/Tacking Stitch (Tinbeetet il Jalileel)


ABOUT US


THE ASSOCIATION FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF PALESTINIAN CAMPS

The Association for the Development of Palestinian Camps in Lebanon (INAASH), was founded in the late 1960s by a group of Lebanese and Palestinian women who foresaw the need to preserve the rich heritage of Palestinian embroidery, and simultaneously provide financial support for destitute refugee families in camps in Lebanon.

The first embroidery workshop opened in Shatila Camp in 1968; followed by a second, with a kindergarten and dispensary, in 1974. Since that time almost 10,000 women have been trained; they have produced close to three million pieces of handiwork.

Inaash supports over 250 pre-school camp children in early education programs. Its pre-school places the children of its female embroiderers in a safe learning environment while allowing their mothers time and space to work. Over the years, thousands of children have completed this early education program and continued on in the UNRWA school system.

For more info, go to INAASH’s website: www.inaash.org/

Embroidered and beaded Najaf  (Iraqi camel wool) Abaya by INNASH - Photo by Dina Debbas ©INAASH MMVI


OMARJOSEPH NASSER-KHOURY (Omarivs Ioseph Filivs Dinæ)

OmarJoseph Nasser-Khoury (b.1988) is a Palestinian designer from Al-Quds and Birzeit. For his first design collection, he worked closely with INAASH to produce 22 garments that were exhibited in 2011 at the Mosaic Rooms Gallery in London on the fringes of Fashion Week. One of the jackets embroidered by INNASH in that collection was subsequently acquired by the British Museum in London as an example of the contemporary development of Palestinian design and embroidery. Nasser-Khoury is currently on an MA course in Social Anthropology at Goldsmiths College in London, concentrating his studies on Palestinian dress and design. As part of this project he also hopes to conduct part of his fieldwork research on embroidery and design practices whilst running this workshop. To know more about his fieldwork and dissertation go to this link: http://omarivs.tumblr.com/post/116385106515/goldsmiths-ma-social-anthropology-dissertation

For more information visit the designer’s Blog: http://omarivs.tumblr.com/

Jacket acquired by the British Museum - Silk Thread Martyrs Collection, Photo ©Omarivs Ioseph Filivs Dinæ & Tarek Moukaddem MMX


WHAT WE NEED & WHY...

TOTAL BUDGET $14,859 (approx. $15,000)

'Whatever extra funding we raise, or any extra to the estimated budget remains, will revert to INAASH's embroidery projects in Lebanon'

Budget is for 12 days of intensive training at 5 hours of training per day for 15 trainees in addition to prep days and organising from early May to mid June.


Budget Breakdown and Details:

1. Trainee Expenses (Max 15 trainees): $6,400

·  $2,700: Transportation Fees for participants (estimated at $15 average travel fare per trainee from camps to Beirut)

·  $3,600: Per Diem Stipend ($20 per trainee per day)

·  $100: Refreshments during workshop (at $10 coffee, $10 tea, $20 biscuits, $60 Water)


2. Workshop Organiser/Assistant Fee: $800

·  At rate of $50 per day inc. transport: 12 training days plus 4 preparation days.


3. INAASH Training Site Costs (Maintenance and Running): $390

·  $240: Running costs (cleaning, opening and closing site) at $20 per day

·  $100: Electricity expenses during workshop (estimated)

·  $50: Sanitary Expenses (tissues, cleaning materials, etc.)


4. Trainer’s (OmarJoseph Nasser-Khoury) Expenses: $3,192

·  $1200: Air travel expenses to/from London/Beirut inc. insurance (estimated)

·  $252: Local travel expenses (estimated at $6 per day for 6 weeks)

·  $900: Rent inc. bills for 6 weeks (estimated)

·  $840: Other living expenses & subsistence (estimated at $20 per day)


5. Material Expenses: $1,077

·  $420: Fabrics

o  $210: 0.5m silk per trainee ($28/m)

o  $120: 0.5 cotton per trainee ($18/m)

o  $90: 0.5 embroidery canvas per trainee ($12/m)


·  $529: Haberdashery

o  $60: 2 DMC cotton embroidery thread balls per trainee ($2/ball)

o  $340: 10 Alchemy Yarns Silken Straw skein for group ($34/skein)

o  $50: One thread ball winder for silk skeins per group

o  $30: 2 Fabric scissors for group ($15/pair)

o  $15: 5 Thread clippers for group ($3/pair)

o  $10: 5 Sewing thread spools for group ($2/spool)

o  $15: 3 Packs of embroidery/sewing needles ($5/pack)

o  $9: 3 Boxes of dressmakers’ pins ($3/box)


·  $128: Stationary

o  $5: One pack of 500 sheets of plain paper

o  $6: 2 Dozen pencils ($3/dozen)

o  $12: 3 Dozen Coloured pencils ($4/dozen)

o  $30: One glue stick per trainee ($2/stick)

o  $75: One notebook per trainee ($5/notebook)


6. Project Publication: $3,000 (estimated)

·  Publication summarising the workshop goals, challenges and achievements to be produced at the end of the workshop and sent to partners and supporters. This will also introduce the public to INAASH’s new stitches and products.


In Case We Do Not Meet Our Goal

The minimum funding should cover the designer's travel and living expenses in Beirut and the travel expenses of the trainees from the camps. If we do not meet our funding goal, the designer could look for accommodation with friends if possible, and we could look to cut the Per Diem stipends for the trainees. In terms of materials we can look for recycled fabrics and leftovers as well as borrow what we need in terms of tools (scissors, needles…etc). The same goes for stationary, where it would be possible to recycle, borrow and reuse material. Whatever extra funding we are left with will go to INAASH as a donation to support their future work and development in the camps

Any donations in kind, in terms of material for the workshop or accommodation for the designer will also be very helpful.


HOW IS THIS PROJECT DIFFERENT?

What distinguishes this project is that it's the first of it's kind. Upon the completion of this project, INAASH's embroiderers will be the first to master almost 20 historical stitches from all over historic Palestine.

Moreover INAASH already provides a market for all of its embroiderers. This basically means that all newly learnt skills and techniques will be put into more production and use. There will be no waste of time or effort, and the project will not simply stop at the end of the training workshop. INAASH will be able to introduce more variety and creativity in terms of products and therefore expand their market and sales, which eventually means higher returns for their embroiderers.

INAASH already sell their products at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York and has had many pop-up shops around the world, besides their permanent shop in Beirut. Their work, along with OmarJoseph’s is collected by the British Museum in London.

OmarJoseph Has been involved in researching and exhibition making with Birzeit University Museum in Palestine since 2010, where he has produced three exhibitions on Palestinian Dress and design. He has also worked with the Danish House in Palestine (DHIP) from 2012 to 2014 on a similar design project to train Palestinian craftswomen and fashion students in Fashion design and Palestinian dressmaking.

Link to more on the project ‘Design in Context’ with DHIP [http://www.dhip.ps/index.php?lang=en&page=1...]


RISKS & CHALLANGES

The main challenges we anticipate are shaped by the harsh reality that the embroiders face as stateless refugees living for more than 66 years in the camps throughout Lebanon.  In addition to their pressing responsibilities (families to look after, especially since the great majority of the embroiderers are women) making any involvement in long term projects difficult, most trainees face great difficulties in terms of movment and travel.

The workshop is therefore designed so that no matter how little time a trainee can spare they will leave with at least one skill mastered which they will be able to use and pass on. The workshop is based on learning at least two stitches per day, and ensuring that least one is mastered . Each trainee is  expected to return to their community where they are always interacting with other INAASH embroiderers and pass on their new skills. This is both the historical and contemporary way in which most dressmaking and embroidery skills were passed on in Palestine. From parent to child, sibling to sibling, friend to friend.

Flow of information during training. Background image by Iyad Jadallah ©Birzeit University Museum


It also goes without saying that the trainer will not only be there to share his knowledge, but to also share the experience and knowledge of the embroiderers themselves who already have years of experience in the field. This is particularly worth mentioning especially since OmarJoseph Nasser-Khoury will be simultaneously conducting part of his fieldwork research for his MA studies. The trainees will be made fully aware of this and their participation in any research will be entirely voluntary.


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Spread the word and share this with your family and friends. Your support is invaluable regardless how you wish to show it.

We are eternally grateful - THANK YOU!


Direct Contributions:

Anonymous - UK: £500 ($760)

Anonymous - Palestine: JD300 ($422)


Background Info & Credits

The stitches used in this project were first identified and researched by OmarJoseph Nasser-Khoury as part of his involvement in the ongoing book project 'Stitches From Palestine - An Introduction Manual' since 2010 with Sunbula (Palestinian Fair Trade Handicrafts) in Jerusalem/Palestine and Tania Tamari-Nasir and Widad Kawar who have initiated this project as part of their life long work on Palestinian Dress. The majority of the research for this project was conducted at Birzeit University Museum in Birzeit/Palestine. Special Thanks goes to Sunbula for its continued work in the field of Plaestinian craft and design.

Further research was also conducted at the British Museum in London.

 During the past two months, and especially during Ramadan, we took a
 break from the workshops for the trainees to spend more time with their
 families and to observe the Holy Month. At the same time, the INAASH 
office has been under renovation, and I have been in London working on 
my MA and preparing for my imminent return to Beirut to resume the 
second phase of the project. We are now all looking forward to 
reactivating the training at the beginning of/mid August. There
 are 14 trainees from four different Palestinian Refugee Camps in 
Lebanon, all of whom have shown great commitment and accomplishment. To 
date, these participants have mastered thirteen of the fifteen stitches.

into the INAASH itinerary of products. .
