story:
Under My Roof, Lithuania

Short Summary

Welcome to Fashion Bloc - a virtual gallery introducing you to the undiscovered fashion destinations in Europe. www.fashionbloc.co.uk is a one step place for fashion lovers to meet, explore and shop independent fashion designers from emerging fashion region. We aim to create a bridge between Western audience and talented designers from Eastern Europe by helping the designers reach their international followers.

Fashion Bloc was launched in 2013 by me, Ieva Zubaviciute, a Lithuanian based in London. Fashion journalist by degree and luxury fashion recruiter by profession I have launched Fashion Bloc out of my personal interest in new fashion destinations. I come from the Baltic States and I am aware of the situation - the fashion talent has been overlooked!

In march 2014 I met my current business partner Martin Kucera who raised the question - how can a growing crowd of Fashion Bloc followers buy those designer items they see on the website? This is when we came up with an idea to launch an online gallery-shop together with the existing online magazine about Eastern European fashion.

Mother Eleganza, Lithuania


Work is in progress! We have more than 40 emerging and established designers on our books who are keen to reach their international audience and make new friends through Fashion Bloc. The only missing particle is a brand new website (our current home is built on Word Press). This is our next step to further grow our business. Our second step will be to introduce a pop-up gallery in London where our customers will be able to explore the selected items of the designers, buy them and order to be delivered from our E-Commerce.


What We Need & What You Get


We are raising funds to build a new website with a fully integrated multi-brand E-commerce (online gallery-shop) allowing designers located across Europe to sell to the International customers. We will need to build a complicated E-Commerce platform in order to manage multi-site stock and to ensure best customer service quality. We aim to raise at least £12 000 to build, launch and promote a new Fashion Bloc platform. We have already invested more than £2000 of our personal funds to start the development of a new website.

The money raised will be used on:

  • New website + E-Commerce (enabling online advertising)
  • Initial marketing campaign
  • Legal services
  • Launch party followed by the pop-up gallery in London

In reality, we need much more than £12K but this amount should help us access additional financing towards further development and growth. If for some unfortunate reason we won't be able to reach our aim of £12K, we will still use the money received for the development of the website, although it might affect our deadline which is the first quarter of 2015. Ideally, we are aiming to organize an amazing Eastern European fashion and art feast (filled with quality fashion, music and not your traditional type of delicacies) by the end of February.

Marchi, Ukraine

Great perks for our supporters:

Besides of making us and a bunch of talented designers happy, you will get personal thank-you notes and gifts.

For example, if you donate £5, we will add your name to the Fame Wall which will be shared on our social media channels. 

For donating £20 you will be featured on our media channels and receive a hand signed special edition card illustrated by our designer Veronika Kallaur.

For donating £65 you will receive a unique petal collar designed and made by Toma Accessories. This is a unique piece of art - no two identical available.

Toma Accessories (£65) - SOLD OUT


For donating £45 you are entitled to one of the two colourful bow ties. These are unique accessories (or a perfect gift) designed and hand-made by Toma Accessories.

Toma Accessories (Checked bow tie, £45)


Toma Accessories (Flower print bow tie, £45)


Another option for your £35 donation is a set of 3 brooch clips (or hair pins). This beautiful mix and match accessories designed and hand made by Toma Accessories are perfect for creative souls (you can wear them separately or all together). Only 1 unique gift available!

Toma Accessories (£35)


For your donation of £40 you will get a mini leather wallet designed and hand-made by Under My Roof. You can choose one of 3 colour options: yellow, blue or black. Each is unique and great! 


Under My Roof (£40)


For only £30 you are not only helping Fashion Bloc but also buying  a set of 2 hand-made leather bracelets by Under My Roof (mix and match or share with a friend). A perfect little perk on your wrist.

Under My Roof (£30)


For £40 of your generosity Lithuanian designer Laura Dailideniene is treating you with a double gift! Yes, right - two presents for you in time before Christmas. Small (25cm X 15cm) grey leatherette 'Cityscape' + a pair of acrylic earrings 'Owl Eyes'! That's what we call a deal! 

Daili by Laura Dailideniene (£40) - SOLD OUT


For £60 you will get a unique Fashion Bloc T-Shirt  (Pretty or Fun) and much more. Fashion Bloc's exclusive cotton T-Shirt (chose your theme and size) is delivered to your door step and will make you happy! Design & Layout by talented graphic designer Dovydas Stonkus, beautifull fashion illustration by Fashion Bloc designer Veronika Kallaur, #slippersnsocks model... big secret! Order yours now!

T-Shirt + more  £60


For only £165 you will buy a piece of art! A Serbian-Croatian designer, living and creating in Canada, is offering you his last limited edition 100% silk dress. Available in Europe through Fashion Bloc Indiegogo campaign. This great dress is decorated in designers original digital artwork and has an adjustable belt to be a 'one size fits all'. We are extremely pleased to give this opportunity to our friends! 

Zoran Dobric (£165)


For donating £200 you access a limited edition Tadam! Jewellery and more! Tadam! Jewellery is hand-made and baked (for real) in Lithuania. It looks, feels and even smells good. Gold plated ceramic jewellery is a perfect gift (even to yourself) Comes in a scented packaging (any of these 6 beauties can be yours).

Tadam! (£200)


If you are generous enough to donate £1000 we are offering you a personalised shopping experience and a free designer item of your choice (a bag, an dress, or a pair of shoes?).

£2000 folks get into serious business talks (free advertising on Fashion Bloc, Market research, business introductions) or a true luxury experience - a personally designed piece exclusively for you!

Moreover, we will chose 3 lucky supporters (despite the amount they donate) to attend our launch party and even bring friends.

The Impact

A very important thing to note - by supporting this campaign (either by donating, or by spreading the word and sharing your ideas with us) you are becoming a part of the history. In the face of the challenges Eastern Europe is facing (followed by the political crisis in Ukraine), we are trying to raise awareness through fashion, which is an international language. We aim to show the world that Eastern Europe (including the Baltic States and Central Eastern Europe) is a hidden fashion gem growing and producing talented, forward thinking, internationally oriented fashion artists and creativity overall. Fashion is not just London, Paris, Milan and New York. Fashion is Kiev, Vilnius, Tallinn, Lodz and many more European cities. By promoting fashion designers from former Eastern Bloc countries (yes, right, this is what Fashion Bloc stands for) we also promote these countries minimizing a gap between Eastern and Western Europe.

Veronika Kallaur, Belarus

Fashion Bloc will be filling a gap in the fashion industry by not only promoting diversity but also introducing new names, affordable designer fashion and much more - a possibility to actually discover different European cultures. 

E-Commerce is one of the most growing business in the fashion industry (clothing being the second most sought item bought online after books). Only in UK people spent £91 bn shopping online in 2013. This number is growing. And thus it might be the right timing to jump on the ship.

We have already built successful relationship with fashion designers and fashion organisations in Belarus, Croatia, Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, Poland, Serbia and Ukraine and the list is growing - we will be updating you about our progress. 

Fashion Bloc will not be an E-Commerce in the usual perception, it will be a fashion art gallery where you can meet, explore and buy designer fashion and more learning about the culture, ideology and history of every item, each designer and even a country of origin. We celebrate #madeineurope.

Risks & Challenges

The right timing, focus and determination is a key for success. In our case, we aim to launch a new online gallery-shop during the season of Fashion Week in order to reach more of our target audience. We will do our best to make this happen.

Fashion Bloc's success belongs not only to us but also to you - the further the word travels, the more potential followers, friends and contributors get to know us.Our challenge is to constantly grow our audience. Every piece of art looks sad if nobody is looking at it.

Without a new multi-functional website we are unable to develop further Fashion Bloc plans to build a 360 Eastern European creativity and culture movement.

Our challenge is to reach our audience at the right time - please do spread the word!

Zoran Dobric, Serbia


    Other Ways You Can Help

    • We value your opinion and professional insight more than anything - do get in touch if you want to share ideas or become a part of this journey. Contact me at ieva@fashionbloc.co.uk, don't be shy!
    • Do reach out if you are interested to write about Fashion Bloc or for Fashion Bloc!
    • We are also looking for E-Commerce development, Legal and Marketing professionals. If this where you can help - do get in touch.
    • We also value your contribution in spreading the word - please use Indiegogo sharing tools to inform your friends about our campaign. Every sharing helps!
    • Follow Fashion Bloc on Twitter @fashionbloc, Facebook @Fashion Bloc and Instagram @fashionbloc
    Fashion Bloc in Media (London to Minsk)

    Cosmopolitan.lt (Lithuania)

    Mieste.lt (Lithuania)

    Pret-a-portal.by (Belarus)

    Nokoncept.com (Estonia)

    Pigeonsandpeacocks.com (London)

story:
The Story Behind The Brand-

Hi! My name is Tanushree Pande. 

I am the creative director and founder of Toronto based label- POPLYN. 

I launched my brand in August 2013 with a women’s clothing line comprising of 10 looks and started out by participating in local art and craft fairs as well as selling through fashion events.

In April 2014, I was one of the chosen designers at Arts & Fashion Week, Toronto (FAT2014) where I presented my SS2014 line inspired by TTC (Toronto Transit Commission) and had a successful show with live audience and an ambience where the runway was transformed into a TTC subway with props and music. 

♕ House of POPLYN ♔♤

My label is fun, cheerful and edgy with the majority of clientele between 20 to 35 year old urban youth. My label currently comprises of 80% womenswear and 20% menswear in clothing, jewellery and accessories.

Everything is designed and created by me in my home studio, located in downtown Toronto.


The Project-

The next collection for Poplyn is getting ready. I am currently finalizing designs and will soon start the patterns and sewing. The collection will be fully finished and ready by end of March 2015. I will start sending out limited edition merchandise and perks to all supporters by early Jan to end of Feb. 

The launch will happen in Toronto.

To have a successful launch for 'House of Poplyn' I need to get the media and local customer's attention by organizing a welcome soiree. 

The soft launch is scheduled for SPRING 2015 and will have an opening night where I will organise a meet and greet. I will also be available for a chat with an introduction to my latest collection and to talk about the label. 

The launch night will also invite local artists and emerging talent from within the community. It will give us all a great opportunity to come together and celebrate local talent and fashion.


The Philosophy-

Recently I realised there is a major gap in the local pop up events and craft fairs when it comes to fashion designers. 

If you look for only fashion based pop up events, currently there are very few to none and there is a lack of collaborative setup for emerging designers in clothing and jewelry, in downtown Toronto where they can pull together a pop up event with shared space and costs.

My aim with this campaign is to raise enough funds to have a successful launch for my studio and designer pop up store to be located in downtown Toronto.

The main idea behind is to have a set up where I can have my label in a shop with a studio space at the back and designers can come together to present their work in fashion, accessories and jewellery with no one in between taking commissions on every sale. 

The space will initially be set up as a pop up at various locations around downtown, where I will rent an entire store for a month long term and invite other designers to join me and sell directly to their customers.

I hope to make it a permanent set up by the end of 2015.

Where does your contribution go- 

The Milestones for the campaign-
$ 1000 raised - the SS15 collection is developed and comes to life with 10 looks
$ 2000 raised - the runway debut of House of Poplyn SS2015 collection 
$ 5000 raised - Spring Soiree held in Toronto, with the big launch of House of Poplyn. This will be a meet and greet to come and connect with local talent with focus towards building a community of designers and artists. This will also mark the launch of House of POPLYN pop-up collab shops within Toronto, an idea that will help raise awareness and interest towards emerging talents in fashion.
$ 7000 raised - If we reach our goal, it helps with promotions and media exposure for House of Poplyn pop up collab shops. This will get us the initial push we need to get the word out and bring the first pop up collab to life. The initial date for the 1st pop up is to be sometime in Spring (March - May 2015)
$10,000 raised - If we go beyond our budget and get a 10k funding, it will make the 1st month long pop-up collab and studio space a reality.
$15,000 + raised - A continuous support towards the House of Poplyn studio and pop up space that can mean another soiree to support local talent and expand our plan.

The Perks-

When you back my campaign you get a Thank-You gift, no matter how big or small, the contribution! Every penny counts!

A complete list of perks with more info about the launch details along with updates on my campaign's progress and development of my new collection will constantly be updated.

Needless to say, everyone based in and around Toronto will be invited to be a part of the big launch and to celebrate the next step with us.

I would appreciate all the support I can get. You will be backing up a local talent and helping me start the new collection and launch my studio, where I can return the favor and support local artists too! 


Other Ways You Can Help-

Help me get the word out and make some noise about my campaign within your friend circles and peers.

Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Also find me on social media and ask about any updates or questions you might have regarding my label.

http://www.twitter.com/_POPLYN

http://www.facebook.com/houseofpoplyn

http://www.houseofpoplyn.com

http://www.instagram.com/stylescribbles

Read about us here-

https://www.toovia.com/articles/the-evolution-of-toronto-fashion-brand-house-of-poplyn

story:
MEDIUMRARE

At the 2015 Experimental Fashion Event, artists and designers from the MICA Fiber Department’s Multi Media Event class work collaboratively to transform The Lithuanian Hall into a venue for innovative fashion and garment based performance. During the event, students present their individually crafted garment-based works, pushing the boundaries of fashion and art. The fashion event represents a variety of concepts and skill sets, with work speaking to the performative nature of fashion. The evening will involve more than 200 people, including designers, and their hand-selected models and performers.

We would like to raise at least $3,000 for our event. The majority of this money will go towards paying for our location, the Lithuanian Hall in southwest Baltimore. This location will cost us approximately $2,000 to rent for the time we need. The other funds will be used to rent lighting and sound equipment, as the hall has none for us to use. In order to achieve this goal we have created some great perks for you! These include tote bags and t-shirts that will be hand screen-printed by the designers, photographic prints of our work, and even a VIP experience at the show!

We need your contribution in order to use the Lithuanian Hall and keep the show out in the Baltimore City area. Any contribution is greatly appreciated!

Keep checking back on this page for more information about different designers, their work, and where to buy tickets for the show.

MEDIUMRARE: An Experimental Fashion Event

April 18, 2015
5PM & 8PM
Lithuanian Hall
851 Hollins St.
Baltimore, MD

Featuring the work of:

  • Lo Ashford
  • Christianna Clark
  • Elise Drake
  • KT Bierman
  • Cindy Stauffer
  • Izzy Garcia
  • K Xing
  • Karyn Lao
  • Katie Kocur
  • Kurina Sohn
  • Sara Keller
  • Aqeel Malcolm
  • Molly Sydnor
  • Moon Choi
  • Ronesha Davis

The evening will involve more than 200 people, including designers, and their hand-selected models and performers.
We would like to raise at least $3,000 for our event. The majority of this money will go towards paying for our location, the Lithuanian Hall in southwest Baltimore. This location will cost us approximately $2,000 to rent for the time we need. The other funds will be used to rent lighting and sound equipment, as the hall has none for us to use. In order to achieve this goal we have created some great perks for you! These include tote bags and t-shirts that will be hand screen-printed by the designers, photographic prints of our work, and even a VIP experience at the show!
We need your contribution in order to use the Lithuanian Hall and keep the show out in the Baltimore City area. Any contribution is greatly appreciated!Keep checking back on this page for more information about different designers, their work, and where to buy tickets for the show.MEDIUMRARE: An Experimental Fashion EventApril 18, 20155PM & 8PMLithuanian Hall851 Hollins St.Baltimore, MD
Featuring the work of:
Lo Ashford
Christianna Clark
Elise Drake
KT Bierman
Cindy Stauffer
Izzy Garcia
K Xing
Karyn Lao
Katie Kocur
Kurina Sohn
Sara Keller
Aqeel Malcolm
Molly Sydnor
Moon Choi
Ronesha Davis

story:
Where it began:

We began because of you and your story. When So Worth Loving began as an inspirational blog on Tumblr, we stenciled this phrase on pieces of already loved clothing. We realized quickly, through an outpouring of honest and inspiring stories and testimonies, that So Worth Loving was so much more than just a phrase. A lifestyle had unexpectedly grown out of three little words and it dug far deeper than we could have ever imagined.

Today, So Worth Loving is a community of passionate and original individuals. We exist to embrace your past and empower your future. We believe no matter your history, past mistakes, religion, career choice, or relationship status, you are worthy of love. We focus on living life through the lens of knowing you have value and you have worth.

Because fashion is the most iconic way to make a statement, we’ve sewn our hearts to the sleeves of apparel that dares you to live louder and love deeper. So whenever you wear a piece made by So Worth Loving, you are reminding the world of a message that we so often forget: you are valued. You are loved. You are worth fighting for.


Stories from our community:

"Those early years of mine were spent in the shadows, hiding in my shame, holding onto a dark secret that was destroying my self worth. I sometimes still find it hard to believe that I was sexually abused as a child. It lead me down a path of ultimate destruction, and as I teetered on the brink I somehow found the courage to look away and begin my journey back. The road back has been bumpy and uneven but has been worth it. It's on this road that I discovered myself again. It's here that I realized that I'm actually worth something and that shame is the enemy of self worth. Finally, I've realized that self worth is a journey to be embraced, not a destination." -Andy Ryan

"Growing up there was a strong presence of abandonment and rejection over my life. My real father was in another country with a new family, and we didn't meet for the first time until I was 17. My step-father was present but never accepted me as his own.  It seemed that wherever I turned, I was an unwanted burden. This hugely affected my self-worth and understanding that I am lovable, acceptable and beautiful. I'm still learning this by rejecting the lies of my past, and instead choosing daily to believe the fact that I am endlessly valuable. I'm not perfect and struggle often, but forgiveness has given me the freedom to redefine my worth. We cannot erase people's  decisions that have impacted us, but we can choose how much they affect our future." -Micaela Hollins

"Growing up there were multiple lies that were spoken over my life; I was not good enough, I was unlovable, I was not pretty enough, and I certainly was not smart enough to change any of these thoughts about myself. At sixteen all these thoughts that I believed were confirmed by my biological parents giving me away to a new family. This made me feel like I wasn't worth loving. My self-worth was replaced with self-hate and addictions. After a many challenging years of discovering my self-worth I have learned that those thoughts ARE lies and that I am not who others say I am. Although, I still struggle with these lies it is essential to daily make an effort to determine my thought process in order to accept the love that I deserve. You can't change what others think of you, but you can shout words of love to the lies you believe and begin on the journey to loving yourself well!" -Melissa Damminger


So Worth Loving presents the "Free To Be" tour. You have a story worth telling and we want to tell it. 

One thing in common:

Dealing with our personal struggles we tend to believe the lie that we are alone in the midst of pain. To escape this pain we begin to compromise and make decisions based off our sadness instead of what we deserve or what we are worth. When emails flooded our inbox, there were two things they all had in common. Feeling alone and feeling unworthy of anything good. If only each person knew that someone else felt the same way.  

How you can help:

We believe that sharing your story will bring light to someone else's tunnel. In each city we tour, we plan to capture stories of self-worth that may be shared globally. Bringing love and community to each city and connecting like minded people together. While we have a growing online community we feel that at this venture it is important to meet you face to face. Sharing your story has the ability to impact someone else's life for the better. It has the ability to remind others they are worth loving. This tour needs to happen now. There is no other time. This message is honest and has the ability to change relationships, careers, and lives for the better. You may have a friend that needs to hear this message. Be an advocate for you. Be an advocate for your friend!


$27,000 is going towards:

  • GET US ON THE ROAD FOR YOU AND YOUR FRIENDS! We need to get our van running and road ready!
  • DOCUMENT YOUR STORY! A traveling photographer/videographer to document stories of self-worth so that we may share them globally online and face to face. Whether it's through college campuses or pushing it out on the web!
  • BRING US TO YOU. Gas money- We will be traveling over 6000 miles across the U.S and gas ain't cheap! 
  • FEED YOU AND YOUR FRIENDS! Food for the events we create
  • BE YOURSELF! Free To Be merch for the road to represent this lifestyle and way of thinking!

story:
Guarda il video in italiano!


Anna Chiatti Firenze

Hi, my name is Anna Chiatti, I’m an italian shoe designer and stylist.

The last past years I worked for several Tuscan shoe factories. Recently I decided to create my own personal collection, called “Anna Chiatti Firenze”. The brand is defined by my name and my city. My approach is based on the innovative technique of using TPU for the bottom of the shoe.

TPU is a colorful and translucent rubber which allows for ornaments even on the upper. From the beginning of my adventure, I'm surrounded by precious people with whom I have created a very collaborative team. Thanks to them, it was possible to refine what once was just an idea. I believe that the result is a really innovative shoe, fashionable and comfortable at the same time, thanks to the rubber sole.

Why crowdfunding?

To promote my " Anna Chiatti Firenze" brand, I need a sample collection. In order to develop the next sample collection, you first need to study trends in fashion, accessories, high heels, everything that can be useful to design and draw the prototypes. In a second phase, I will have to contact the manufacturers and suppliers of individual components, such as factories heels, factories forms, tanneries, uppers and soles factories, which are fundamental for assembling shoes.

This sample collection will be my business card and is required to present my brand to Italian and foreign buyers. Unfortunately, producing a sample collection is very expensive, especially if itʼs entirely made in Italy, as is my case. The Spring Summer 2015 sample collection will allow me to participate in trade fairs like the Micam Shoe Event in Milan and the “Shoes from Italy” exhibition in Tokyo.

Up to the present, I have used my personal economic resources to pursue this project. Now I need to invest more and I need the aid of those who believe in my idea.


Reflection of Elegance

My project was born from the desire to share with other women the opportunity to be beautiful without sacrificing comfort, wearing shoes with original design but suitable for any time of the day. Businesswomen ourselves, mothers, lovers, workers and housewives: each of us is at the same time all this and much more! My line of fashion shoes includes desires and aspirations of dynamic and resolute women that want to live a bright life in a reflection of elegance!


How to support me 

If you want to support the next Anna Chiatti Firenze collection, take a look at the perks column. You will find not only my shoes, but a number of accessories sharing the same style of the collection. Even your smallest contribution is essential.

You can also help me by spreading this campaign to your friends, through the social networks or the Indiegogo share tools!!

Thanks to all of you!!!


www.annachiatti.it


Do you want to know how to contribute?  Watch the video on how to support the campaign!!



Choose your perks!

In the right column, you will find some items to buy to support my project!

All of the gadgets, such as bracelet, key ring or iPhone/iPad case, are designed by me and made of smocked black TPU and genuine calf leather or nubuck. The bracelet and the iPhone/iPad case have a magnetic closure and chrome metal finishes.


Anna Chiatti Firenze shoes!

If you like my project and want to buy my products to contribute to the realization of the next sample collection, choose one of the models listed in the perks! 

All the Anna Chiatti Firenze collection is made entirely in Italy, with top quality materials. You can choose between calf leather, nubuck, crocodile or ostrich printed calf leather, or bronze varnished. The colors are black or dark-brown. 

And of course, all the shoes have bottom or bands made of smocked black TPU!


How to choose?

At the end of the campaign (April 7th), I will send you an email to know your size and the model you have chosen based on the price range of your contribution.

Now, take a look at the Autumn Winter 2014-2015 Anna Chiatti Firenze collection!










-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Anna Chiatti Firenze

Ciao, mi chiamo Anna Chiatti, sono una stilista e modellista calzaturiera. 

Per molti anni ho lavorato per alcuni calzaturifici toscani, ma da qualche tempo ho deciso di realizzare una mia collezione personale, la Anna Chiatti Firenze, un brand definito dal mio nome e dalla mia città.

Ho deciso di affacciarmi sul mercato nazionale ed estero avendo studiato ed elaborato un’idea nuova: una scarpa con un fondo in TPU! 

Il TPU è una gomma colorata e semitrasparente, utilizzabile anche con dei richiami sulla tomaia. Per questo la linea Anna Chiatti Firenze è unica ed esclusiva.

All’inizio della mia avventura mi sono circondata di persone valide con cui ho creato un team molto collaborativo. Grazie a loro, è stato possibile perfezionare quello che prima era solo un’idea. Credo che il risultato sia una scarpa davvero innovativa, fashion e allo stesso comoda, grazie alla suola in gomma.


Perché il crowdfunding?

Per promuovere la linea “ Anna Chiatti Firenze” ho bisogno di un campionario. Per realizzarlo occorre studiare le tendenze della moda, gli accessori, i tacchi, tutto ciò insomma che può essere utile per ideare e disegnare i modelli.

Poi vanno contattati i produttori e fornitori delle singole componenti, come tacchifici, formifici, concerie, suolifici e tomaifici, fondamentali per assemblare le scarpe.

Il campionario è il mio biglietto da visita ed è necessario per proporsi ai compratori italiani ed esteri, ma purtroppo è molto costoso soprattutto se realizzato interamente in italia come nel mio caso.

Grazie al nuovo campionario Primavera Estate 2015 potrò partecipare a fiere come il Micam di Milano e la fiera della calzatura a Tokyo.

Fino ad ora ho utilizzato le mie risorse economiche personali ma per proseguire in questo progetto ho bisogno di investire ancora e dell’aiuto di chi crede nella mia idea.



I riflessi dell'eleganza

Il mio progetto nasce dal desiderio di condividere con le altre donne la possibilità di essere belle senza rinunciare alla comodità, indossando calzature dal design originale e adatto ad ogni momento della giornata. Imprenditrici di noi stesse, mamme, amanti, lavoratrici e donna di casa: ognuna di noi è tutto questo allo stesso tempo e molto di più!

La mia collezione di scarpe di moda contiene i desideri e le aspirazioni delle donne vitali e determinate che vogliono vivere una vita luminosa in riflessi di eleganza.



Come potete aiutarmi 

Per sostenere la prossima collezione firmata “Anna chiatti Firenze” dai un’occhiata alla colonna dei perks. Troverai, oltre alle mie scarpe, una serie di accessori realizzati seguendo lo stile della collezione. 

Anche il tuo più piccolo contributo è indispensabile. 

Puoi aiutarmi anche diffondendo questa campagna tra i tuoi amici, tramite i social networks o grazie agli strumenti di condivisione di Indiegogo!

Grazie a tutti voi!!

www.annachiatti.it


Vuoi sapere come poter contribuire? Guarda il video sulle modalità con cui supportare questa campagna!!


Scegli il tuo perks!

Nella colonna di destra, troverai alcuni gadget da acquistare per sostenere il mio progetto!

Tutti gli oggetti, come i braccialetti, il portachiavi o la custodia per iPhone/iPad, sono disegnati da me e realizzati in TPU nero fumé e vera pelle di vitello o nabuk.

I braccialetti e le custodie per iPhone/iPad hanno una chiusura a calamita e finiture in metallo cromato.


Anna Chiatti Firenze!

Se ti piace il mio progetto e vuoi acquistare la mia collezione per contribuire alla realizzazione del campionario Primavera Estate 2015, scegli uno dei modelli indicati nella colonna dei perks!


Tutte le calzature Anna Chiatti Firenze sono interamente fatte in Italia, con materiali di prima qualità. Puoi scegliere tra pelle di vitello, nabuck, vitello stampato in coccodrillo o struzzo, oppure vernice bronzo. I colori sono nero e testa di moro.

E, ovviamente, tutte le calzature hanno la suola o le fasce decorative in TPU nero fumé!


Come scegliere?

Alla fine della campagna (prevista per il 7 Aprile), ti invierò un'email per sapere la tua taglia e il modello da te scelto in base alla fascia di prezzo del tuo contributo!

Ora, dai un'occhiata alla collezione Anna Chiatti Firenze Autunno Inverno 2014-2015 presentata nella descrizione in lingua inglese e supporta la campagna di Anna Chiatti!

story: Hey guys, we're re-doing our campaign and will be back soon!!
story_txt: Hey guys, we're re-doing our campaign and will be back soon!!

story:
About the Artist 

My name is Tamao Nakayama. I was born in Tokyo, Japan, and raised by a master Kimono maker. There were many craftsmen in my neighborhood at that time. A lot of houses were still in the traditional style. The wooden windows, Washi paper doors, and rice straw mattresses were big elements in Japanese architecture. I was surrounded by those natural materials and grew up watching old craftsmen create their one-of-a-kind crafts.

Even though I’ve been living in the US (California) and I am far from traditional, I'm often surprised that my artwork does look strongly Japanese. Once my friend said: “You can take the girl out of Japan, but you can not take Japan out of the girl.” I like the unexpected beauty that comes from blending the traditional with the contemporary.

My designs are intended to be wearable art that bring inner peace and calmness. Each piece is individually handcrafted with precision.  I'm pleased to share my designs with you.

Perks (Jewelry and Coupons)

Please make sure to include a valid shipping address for any perks. More details on estimated ship dates are below.

Maple Earrings and Necklace

Materials: 14K filled gold wires, cultured freshwater pearls, maple wood.

Earring dimensions: Drop length 8.1 cm (3-3/16") / Width 0.9 cm (3/8") / Depth 0.5 cm (3/16").

Necklace dimensions: Drop length 8.1 cm (3-3/16") / Width 1.2 cm (7/16") / Depth 0.6 cm (1/4") / Chain 45.72 cm (18").

Note: Jewelry is delicate. I use finish that is water-resistant, but products cannot be submerged. I use only non-toxic wood-finish.

 

Walnut Earrings and Necklace

Materials: 14K filled gold wires, cultured freshwater pearls, walnut wood.

Earring dimensions: Drop length 8.1 cm (3-3/16") / Width 0.9 cm (3/8") / Depth 0.5 cm (3/16").

Necklace dimensions: Drop length 8.1 cm (3-3/16") / Width 1.2 cm (7/16") / Depth 0.6 cm (1/4") / Chain 45.72 cm (18").

Note: Jewelry is delicate. I use finish that is water-resistant, but products cannot be submerged. I use only non-toxic wood-finish.

 

Coupons for the Art De Tama Online Shop 

If you want to help my startup-studio, but you don't care for the Shizuku-Dewdrop jewelry collection, a coupon is available for you to use at the Art De Tama online shop any time after our shop is open in January 2019. Or give it to a friend! More designs coming soon.

 

Risks & Challenges

Since I make everything in my own studio, the risk is minimal. The only challenge I might face is that if this is to be a wildly successful campaign (a wonderful problem to have!), I may need more time to produce the perks. Ideally, I want to send out all perks to everyone by Christmas (so you’ll get an extra present under the tree!). But because I don't know how many orders I will get from this campaign, I am putting an estimated ship date of December 31st, 2018 to give myself a little extra time.  If any issues do arise, I will burn the midnight oil to make sure everyone receives their pieces on time, as that is my highest priority.

I understand not everyone likes the idea of crowdfunding, so if you don't, feel free to purchase any of these items from my online shop (but at a higher rate). I’m preparing to open my online shop in January 2019.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't want to contribute here, don't fret! Social media is a great way to make your voice heard. If you don’t mind, please share this with your friends and followers. If you have a friend who is into this style, send them this link. I will really appreciate it!
story_txt:
About the Artist 
My name is Tamao Nakayama. I was born in Tokyo, Japan, and raised by a master Kimono maker. There were many craftsmen in my neighborhood at that time. A lot of houses were still in the traditional style. The wooden windows, Washi paper doors, and rice straw mattresses were big elements in Japanese architecture. I was surrounded by those natural materials and grew up watching old craftsmen create their one-of-a-kind crafts.
Even though I’ve been living in the US (California) and I am far from traditional, I'm often surprised that my artwork does look strongly Japanese. Once my friend said: “You can take the girl out of Japan, but you can not take Japan out of the girl.” I like the unexpected beauty that comes from blending the traditional with the contemporary.
My designs are intended to be wearable art that bring inner peace and calmness. Each piece is individually handcrafted with precision.  I'm pleased to share my designs with you.

Perks (Jewelry and Coupons)
Please make sure to include a valid shipping address for any perks. More details on estimated ship dates are below.
Maple Earrings and Necklace

story:
Background:

My name is Jennifer Nnamani, Founder and Creative Director of Fashion Enive. I've been active in the fashion industry for more than 5 years and continuously observed the lack of representation and highlight by the media on ecofriendly/ethical/sustainable brands. These words are used interchangeably to describe designers that practice safer methods in designing their garments. Fashion Envie is very important to me because it is a vehicle to promote social change in fashion. We all know the importance of our environment and the effects that our actions have on it. Fashion as a culture becomes a communicating tool to bring about that change. Fashion Envie is a grassroots movement to celebrate these designers and artists--as well as brands that come onboard as sponsors/partners.


The Impact

-Fashion Envie's goal is to rebrand the concept of Eco-friendly as an essential need for our environment. 

- Partner up with Wecyclers-- an environmentally focused organization that teaches low income communities on the importance of recycling and social responsibility in Africa. (www.weyclers.com)

-Through Fashion Envie, we will provide tools to designers to get their designs to the world. Our impressive media outreach for Fashion Envie 2013 was featured in more than 7 countries:

Fashion Envie 2013 Press:

U.S.A: http://applauseafrica.com/art-culture/21-beau-monde-society-fashion-envie-a-midsummer-jungle-ecoventure

U.S.A: http://www.mediafritiq.com/2013/04/20/fashion-envie-midsummer-jungle/

Nigeria: http://zenmagazineafrica.com/editorials/eco-friendly-fashion-envie/

Nigeria: http://www.bellanaija.com/2013/06/02/re-branding-the-concept-of-eco-friendly-fashion-view-zen-magazines-editorial-fashion-envie/

Australia: http://ecowarriorprincess.net/2013/03/eco-friendly-fashion-event-fashion-envies-midsummer-jungle/

U.K: http://todayeco.com/fashion/pages/11961098-eco-friendly-fashion-event-fashion-envies-midsummer-jungle

Australia: http://peppermintmag.com

Mozambique: http://www.africa-vogue.com/?s=fashion+envie

Kenya:http://issuu.com/afroellemagazine/docs/afroelle_anniversary_issue_-_2013


-Encourage young designers to be more sustainable in their approach to fashion.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't financially donate to Fashion Envie, we will also appreciate Word of Mouth marketing or spreading the message of sustainability and FASHION ENVIE. Thank you very much!

story:
Hi, everyone! 

My name is Vladimir. I'm young fashion designer from Russia. I made my first fashion limited collection recently - "Based in Berlin by Vladimir Ostanin". 

You can see video-backstage here 

Full cookbook here: http://vostanin.ru/?p=549

Soon this limited collection will be on sale on etsy.com

And now i wanna take the next step to future success and this campaign should help me make work place.

I need new sewing-machine for knitwear "Brother M4234D" and Tailors' dummy "My Double leg form S" and colored knitwear for perks. I made three patterns for my smart casual brand "VOLOD'KO" and you can get a t-shirt or a dress or a jacket for your help.

Absolutely handmade and unique!

I wanna sew smart casual and unique clothing that people wore it. I'm a good guy and I have a plan what i should do now)))

P.S. sorry for my english 

Thank you for your attention! Find me on the web;)

http://vostanin.ru

https://www.facebook.com/vvostanin

http://instagram.com/v0l0dk0/

http://vk.com/vladimir.ostanin


For russian guest

Привет всем!

Меня зовут Владимир. Я начинающий дизайнер одежды. Совсем недавно я закончил работу над своей дебютной мини-коллекцией "Based in Berlin by Vladimir Ostanin". Я делаю уникальные вещи, которые не тиражируются. Но теперь я хочу расширить свои навыки и начать работать с трикотажем.  Для этого мне необходимо дополнительное оборудование.

Еще я графический дизайнер и все больше занимаюсь иллюстрациями. Все, что я умею сейчас - я научился делать только благодаря усердию и практике. А для того, чтобы уметь еще больше - необходимо оборудовать рабочее место.

Здесь я собираю средства на приобретение оверлока, портновского манекена и трикотажа, из которого будут отшиты по уникальным выкройкам мои презенты за ваши вложения. 

Спасибо за Ваше внимание! Давайте дружить в сети;)

story:
Heartsleeve designs and sells T-shirts that support small, New Orleans Causes in need of funding. Our Indiegogo campaign launches Heartsleeve’s first design and aims to cover many of our one-time start up costs.

Heartsleeve T-shirts are designed in pairs, with two people (best friends, siblings, couples, parent & child, pet owner & dog) - the giver and the receiver - in mind. Our first pair is the I Want to be Bayou line, featuring Louisiana swamp locals, the alligator and the crawfish. The blue shirt showcases an amorous crawfish, while the grey shirt shows a gator with a kiss mark on it's snout.



The pair of shirts is stylistically similar in design and color, but both remain unique. If you just want one, that’s cool too. However, by designing our shirts in pairs, we encourage people to share the pair with someone they love. A strong community is made up of strong relationships, and two friends representing their shared style with a funky Tee is a fun way to show some love for each other and our partner Cause.

We print on soft tri-blend tees for all the adult and youth sizes. The unisex is a crew necked t-shirt and the Womens shirt has a scoop neck with a more fitted cut. Toddler sizes come in  2, 4, and 6. The infant onesie is 100% cotton and super soft. The puppy tee is a jersey blend, white with navy sleeves.

Built into our business plan, Heartsleeve gives an average of $2 of every T-shirt sale to a corresponding partner Cause. For our Bayou design, we're partnering with the Louisiana Master Naturalists of Greater New Orleans (LMNGNO). This non-profit organizes educational outings for about 30 adults each semester. The program immerses locals in the beautiful and fragile environment of Southeast Louisiana to teach them about the plants, animals, and threats to the region. Tuition costs $250 per person, so Heartsleeve is partnering with the LMNGNO to set up a scholarship for folks who demonstrate a personal investment in learning about our coast yet cannot afford the tuition.  We want to eliminate the cost barrier for those passionate to learn about Louisiana’s prolific but disappearing coast.


We've got a couple of ways you can help us launch Heartsleeve:

1. Check out those perks on the right and find a level you like (and a perk you love) and let us reward you with our original designed tees.

2. See all those social media buttons under the video? Share, tweet, and post away to help us make Heartsleeve's launch a reality.

3. Be a rockstar and do both!

Find us on
Twitter @MyHeartsleeve
Instragram MyHeartsleeve
Facebook.com/MyHeartsleeve
Contact us at heartsleevenola@gmail.com

We have been working with the New Orleans Community Printshop & Darkroom (thank you guys!!), and it’s time for us to leave the nest.

Our goal of $8,500 covers the one-time costs of the most expensive screen-printing supplies including a printing press, flash dryer, heat press, as well as space for storage and mass production.

$5700 for equipment costs
printing press ($1600)
flash dryer ($700)
heat press ($1400)
5 screens ($150)
exposure unit ($700)
inks ($400)
power washer ($200)
Pro-Printer ($300)
cleaning supplies/emulsion/squeegees ($250)

$2400 for Printing the Bayou line

$400 for IndieGogo Processing fee (if we make our goal!)

If we surpass our $8,500 goal, we will certainly put that money to good use. Heartsleeve needs a place to live. Whether that’s a studio all it’s own, or an extra room in a house, we will need funding to pay for a place to store, use and create our designs!


We understand what it takes to succeed against seemingly insurmountable odds because we have already done so countless times. Combined, we have 11 years of non-profit development and management under our belts. Because of this extensive experience, both of us have honed skills essential to launching a successful social venture including networking, program development, crisis management, making the ask/sale, managing time and staff, program evaluation, and solving problems creatively in order to work within a limited budget. We also love to create, and you can often find us on adventures in Adobe, painting, making costumes or puppets, taking photos, or playing the guitar.

story:
Pony Scarves

We here at PonyScarves.com have an idea! We want to provide the highest quality My Little Pony sports scarves available anywhere. The only problem is, we can't do it by ourselves. This is where you come in!

We need your help to make our dream a reality!
We have several scarf designs finished and ready to be made into physical scarves, funding is all we are missing. With the purchase of the exclusive Nightmare Moon scarf, you will be helping us fund the production of the other designs. All we need to get is $500 to start production on the Nightmare Moon scarf. If we raise $1,000 we can start production on one of the other scarves we have designed. If we raise $4,000 we can make available all of the mane 6 scarves. (NOTE: These numbers do not include shipping or over head.)

For more info and updates please LIKE our Facebook page.

Perks

$1 Brohoof
A digital "brohoof" from the Pony Scarves staff. We will send you a heartfelt thank you email.

$5 I Heart Scarves Pin Set
We will send you a set of “I heart scarves” buttons and list your name on the our website as a backer of the Hu-Mane Scarf Project.

$10 voucher
We will be launching our website soon after the campaign ends. We will send you a $10 voucher towards your purchase when the site does go live. You will also receive a set of “I heart scarves” buttons and your name listed on the website as a backer of the Hu-Mane Scarf Project.

$25 - $100 Exclusive Nightmare Moon Scarf
We will offer you one of the Exclusive for backers only Nightmare Moon sport style pony scarf. The scarf is roughly 7" x 54" and made of 100% acrylic. This donation level have 4 options. Each donation level includes the "I Heart Scarves" pin set and your name listed on the our website as a backer of the Hu-Mane Scarf Project.
$25 One Exclusive Nightmare Moon Scarf
$50 Two Exclusive Nightmare Moon Scarves
$75 Four Exclusive Nightmare Moon Scarves
$100 Five Exclusive Nightmare Moon Scarves

We will ship to the UK.

The IndieGoGo Exclusive Nightmare Moon Scarf

About the Scarves

The scarves we will be providing are made by Sports Scarf a company based in Massachusetts. They have made plenty of very high quality sought after scarves. Including the ones for Portland's Timbers Army. Below are some images of the quality that goes into every scarf they make.

The production design that sports scarf sent us.

 

About the designer.

I am a Soccer fan, and one of my favorite things about soccer is the plethora of scarves there are. One of the other things I’m really passionate about is My Little Pony Friendship is Magic. On top of being a soccer fan and My Little Pony lover I am also a freelance graphic designer. So I came up with the bright idea of combining the three of the joys in my life.

Time for delivery

Once our project has been funded we will inform our scarf manufacturer to start production, at that point it will be 5 - 6 weeks before the scarves will be shipped to your door.

Risks

A major risk we are taking with this product is making sure the colors are correct from the concept designs to the final product. If we have to we will re order the first batch with tweaked colors and offer the older batch for a much discounted price.
I know a lot of people would like to see a final product before pledging money to this project. I assure all of you I have 100% faith in this company to make the best product available.

story:
Mission

The great outdoors calls to us.

To brave the elements, we bring the warmth with us.

In order to keep your body dry, while enjoying the outdoor, your jacket/trousers/shoes probably contain a so-called "functional membrane". This membrane should stop water from entering but should also permit the sweat to evaporate. Unfortunately, most outerwear contains warming substances that are detrimental to the environment. Wear and tear, as well as regular washing, release non-degradable carcinogenic toxins, as well as microplastics, into the atmosphere and the oceans. In fact, those waterproof and breathable membranes are very often made from a fluorine-containing polymer, which also contains very toxic chemicals, called PFCs. The Detox Campaign from Greenpeace brought to light the effect of those PFCs in the nature (http://detox-outdoor.org/en/campaign/)  and is also what motivated us to find an alternative.

Now, an innovation is here to change all that, taking a cue from nature itself: Sane Membrane. This non-toxic alternative is mineral-based, fluorine-free, and has the option to be biodegradable. And it keeps clothes warm and dry just as effectively as its substitutes.

 

 

Technology

dimpora's sane membrane is the result of 5 years of high tech research in Switzerland and is now being brought to the next level.

The technology involves the use of a sacrificial template that is mixed within the polymer to take up a certain volume. Once dry, this mineral-based template is removed from the membrane, leaving behind interconnected voids, thus forming the porous system, which body needs to breathe!

How is it done?

We take a polymer. We started with a tradtional material (PU, polyurethane) to show that we can do it. We will use biosourced, biodegradable and recycleable options for further generations. The process is open to change, so are we.

 

We take the mineral based template, rocks basically.

We mix them. This is key and we do it properly!

Produce a Membrane. This is done on a machine, spreading it by hand does not afford the regularity we want!

We release the rocks and create the pores:

...and we are done with a waterproof and breathable membrane for your outdoor pleasures.

Thanks to the liquid state of the membrane precursor, it can be seamlessly added to any garment, in the form of a micro-thin layer that shields against rain, snow, and other forces of nature...the sustainable way.

In other words, defense against chill, wind, and rain, can be as natural as Mother Nature herself.

Protect yourself. Protect the planet.

 

Mario, CEO

Mario is a Swiss chemical engineer on paper but a business man in his heart (a good one, promise!). During his master thesis and PhD, he followed his dream of bringing a fluorine-free functional membrane to the market after the Greenpeace detox campaign put the spotlight on the PFCs, that are used in conventional waterproofing equipment. With new polymer options he will add circularity to the membrane world! He is passionate about fishing, skiing and spends most of his free time in the mountains.

Anna, CTO

Anna also comes from Switzerland and is a chemical engineer with a strong connection to science and has a real passion for Research & Development. She was always very involved in sustainability in her research as her PhD involved the development of new polymeric materials for CO2-capture and microplastics tracing. dimpora membranes will not leave a trace. As an avid skier and hiker, Anna is also very motivated to wear products that will not harm the very nature she enjoys.

 

 

Together, dimpora

After studying together at ETH Zurich, Mario and Anna discovered the joy & challenges that comes with bringing your idea to life. The two are highly motivated to continue this journey towards a more transparent and eco-friendly product for the textile world together.

 

 

With the money raised, we will focus on our biodegradable membrane to  avoid any unecessary plastic waste on our planet. This means that we still need a little bit of research and then most importantly, scale-up our technology and bring it to market!

 

We gathered a few amazing and very personal perks. We hope you will enjoy them too and help us achieve our goal.

The rewards:

1. Support our cause with 25€ Donation and we (Anna & Mario) will make a thank you video from the Swiss Alps naming all of you directly. (Let us know if you don't want your name to show up)

2. A high quality sustainable cotton shopping bag 40€ with dimpora logo on it. Cut back unnecessary plastic by taking your tote bag with you every day! It does not contain any membrane.

3. A merino cap made in Switzerland for 90€ with dimpora logo on it. It will keep you warm wherever you need it. It does not contain any membrane.

4. Meet the team 300€. Come see us in our labs in Zurich Switzerland. See how we work and get insights on the next big challenges in the materials side of the textile industry.

 

5. dimpora's first and second generation jacket 600€. Be the first to get a jacket with our Polyurethane (PU)-based membrane inside. The membrane is fluorine-free, highly breathable with very good waterproofing properties. The design of the jacket will be provided by Rotauf, a sustainable partner brand from Switzerland. You will be the first to get your hands on the dimpora PU membrane and test the jackets with and for us. Try it in all your adventures for 12 months or less and if you return it with your personal feedback, we will send you a second generation jacket (optimized). The second generation jacket could not have the exact same design.
x

7. Travel to the Swiss alps with us 2500€. This limited perk involves a full weekend in the alps with us. Depending on the season we can go for example hiking, biking, skiing, fishing... We will take care of the place, food as well as accommodation. This does not involve the transportation costs but we are happy to pick you up at the airport, if this is convenient, as we travel together to the mountains. We can show you the beauty of our homeland and you can enjoy a real Swiss experience.

 

 

 

Thank you!!!!

 

For more questions reach out to us: www.dimpora.com

if you feel like keeping updated about the project. Sign up to our mail list and enjoy the newsletters. You can also find that on our website.

story:
Introducing MAS Watches:

Matthew and Son, or 'MAS' Watches, was founded by Matthew Francis, a watch enthusiast and father, who shares his love of watches with his young son, Tate. Having worked in business over many years, with some of Australia's best known brands, it was time for Matt to scratch that entrepreneurial itch, and turn a personal obsession into a way of life. What better way to do it than with family by your side? So with much excitement, MAS was born!

Matthew and Son seek to design and produce uniquely styled, high quality pieces in a fit and finish that appeals to other watch enthusiasts. Keeping pieces functional and attainable are also important criteria for MAS products. 

"We want to share our passion with like-minded enthusiasts, and pricing our products 'out of reach' runs counter to this desire."

Matthew and Son are excited to present their first timepiece; a dive watch named after a formidable creature found in the coastal waters off North-Eastern Australia. MAS are proud to be Australian owned and operated, and enjoy linking product designs to Aussie flora, fauna, or other unique aspects of the 'Down Under' lifestyle. Knowing this, you'll understand why this little diver was a natural place to start our journey...

 

Meet the Irukandji...

The Irukandji is a feature-packed dive watch, named after a group of small yet highly venomous jellyfish, indigenous to the coastline of Australia's tropics. With a unique design, and a range of premium features and finishes usually found in high priced offerings, the Irukandji is just like its namesake; small in size, but packing a serious punch!  

"I think what MAS is producing here is similar to what got me really excited about divers when I started collecting; a watch that was affordable, didn't break the bank, and really felt special on the wrist. It's really capturing the essence of those Seiko divers that got me into collecting, and if that's what MAS is going for I think they've really nailed it."

Patrick Marlett - Take Time w/ Patrick Marlett

 

Specifications:  

- 316L, marine grade stainless steel case (brushed);  

- drilled lugs, for simple strap changes; 

- domed sapphire crystal with anti-reflective (AR) coating on the underside;  

- 120-click unidirectional bezel, with lumed ceramic insert;  

- signed, screw-down crown (at 10 or 4 o'clock), delivering 200m water resistance;  

- stamped caseback with Irukandji artwork (brushed & polished); 

- automatic Seiko NH35 movement, regulated at the factory. Reliable, and easy, affordable servicing, and being regulated, has better accuracy than your typical off-the-shelf Swiss movement! 

The Irukandji case is 42mm at the wrist, and 39.5mm at the bezel, for a unique case design that suits a variety of wrist sizes and preferences. Lug width is 20mm, and the all-important lug to lug is 46mm. Height comes in at 13.13mm from caseback to bezel, or a 15mm total including nearly 2mm of glorious dome.

 

Design:

When we set out to create our diver, we knew we wanted to deliver something different to the market, without casting aside some of the fundamental design elements that we see in so many of our favourite 'big brand' timepieces. We picked one important aspect that we would not compromise with our final design... the wearability of the timepiece. This saw the gradual evolution of our tapered case, which allows the piece to 'wear smaller' on smaller wrists, without forfeiting presence on a larger wrist. Bingo!

With a unique case taper, flowing into a domed sapphire, and complemented by 'tentacle' lugs, the Irukandji is the design representation of the animal that inspired it:

A signed crown is found at either 10 o'clock or 4 o'clock, based on your preference:

Paying tribute to its design inspiration, the Irukandji caseback is adorned with a stylised jellyfish, oil-pressed in stainless steel (a more premium and durable finish than engraving):

There are three standard colourways available in the Irukandji range: Deadly Black, Reef Blue, and Stinger Pink:

It would be a shame to waste those beautiful drilled lugs... All Irukandji come with two strap options: a colour matched 'quick release' nylon two-piece, and buyer's choice of a rubber or canvas strap.

 

What you get!

When you get an Irukandji (or multiple units), each production package will include the following:

- 1 x Irukandji dive watch (regulated movement) on matching two-piece nylon strap;

- 1 x Rubber or Canvas strap of your choosing;

- 1 x MAS Watches watch roll, to transport your Irukandji and other timepieces;

- Warranty card and MAS Contact card;

- 2 Year Warranty on your Irukandji (parts and workmanship).

You will also have a choice between the standard Irukandji crown (at 10 o'clock), or a more conventional crown placement (at 4 o'clock).

A premium stainless steel 'rivet' style bracelet can also be added for those wishing for a bracelet option (displayed below on the pink variant):

Having already successfully funded on Kickstarter, we are now entering the production phase of the Irukandji project, with service agreements in place with our major manufacturing/parts providers.

All Irukandji units will spend time with MAS Watches, where they will be individually checked and tested for quality, function, and water resistance. They will then be hand packaged and posted direct from MAS to your door; no air drops or fulfilment partners. Final delivery is expected in late October.

 

Reviews:

Irukandji prototypes are currently with reviewers across the globe - check out some of the great feedback they've received so far! Visit YouTube and search 'mas irukandji' for more!

 

 

Shipping Restrictions:

While we love interacting with all of our followers and supporters, and wish we could send our Irukandji anywhere, there are some places that are extremely difficult to send to. For this reason we don't ship to: Saudi Arabia, Kosovo, Cuba, Iran, Iraq, Libya, Somalia, Sudan, North Korea, and Yemen. We trust you'll understand.

As for the rest of the world, purchasers are responsible for any import taxes/duties or other charges that may be imposed by local customs.

 

Extra:

Want to keep across the day-to-day activities of MAS Watches? 

Follow us on Instagram @maswatches 

Subscribe to our mailing list (join in the footer of the MAS website)

 

Extra Pics:

 

Risks & Challenges:

We are confident in our product, and excited about our campaign, but there are some inherent risks involved when bringing anything new to market. Here are some of the common areas of concern, from a MAS perspective.

Budgeting:
This is an area that many new ventures struggle with, as they allow project excitement to get in the way of responsible budgeting and financial management. At MAS we have been very conservative in setting our campaign budget, and have over-budgeted in a number of key areas to ensure we have a buffer in our campaign total to cover anything unexpected.

Timelines:
Again, out of eagerness and excitement, many new businesses set aspirational timelines that don't leave room for delays or unexpected stalls in a process. At MAS, we are proponents of 'under promise and over deliver', and have built healthy buffers into our schedule. If we deliver earlier than promised, that's great, but at the very least you'll get your product on time!

Supplier Issues:
We have strong relationships with our manufacturing and parts provider, and third party strap supplier. Regardless, we have also maintained close relationships with other suppliers to ensure that, if the worst should happen, we have other avenues to keep production on track, and get you your Irukandji.

story:
We are glad to welcome everyone who waited and followed the project! Our story began three years ago, when we successfully launched our first watch NIXOID Classic. 

NIXIE lamps have not been produced for over thirty years, and every year it becomes more difficult to find untouched lamps that can display the time. We searched for a long time and found an untouched warehouse of lamps from the times of the USSR, and the project became possible.

The watch also received tilt sensor,more capacious battery and magnetic charging connector too. Let's further explore what new we have added during this time.

We have thoroughly worked out the new case, this also influenced the size of the watch, now they have become more ergonomic.

Most importantly, we have introduced the accelerometer function, now there is no need to constantly press the button. We made many prototypes and tested them for a long time.   That's not all we have improved our product in, to find out more, read on.

 

NIXOID the world's first Dual-core tube wristwatch.  Watch has two cores, a separate core is responsible for processing only accelerometer data. This technical solution made it possible to improve the autonomy and accuracy of the accelerometer.

 

Materials 

The watch is made of durable weapon-grade aluminum alloy by milling from one piece of metal using high-precision CNC equipment.  The watch has become even thinner and lighter, only 16.9 mm thick.  

 

The top of the watch is covered with a sapphire crystal, with a hardness of 9H. The glass has a high hardness and can`t be scratched. 

 At the watch will be available in 6 colors:

  • Deep Black;
  • Polished Classic;
  • Mars Red;
  •  Military Green; 
  • Violet;
  • Gold
  • PLAZMA Coated;

 Every watch has precision laser engraving with unique serial and backer number.  The straps are made of Fluorine rubber or Steel or Leather. They are very pleasant to the touch, strong and reliable. 

 There is a magnetic connector on the back cover, it is very convenient and gives magic in using the watch. The magnetic connector does not loosen over time and always looks like new. 

 The watch has a knurled button, that is pleasant to the touch and looks beautiful. 

 

Tilt function  

 You can see the time by pressing a button or by gesture. The watch does not respond to accidental hand movements. All movements of the watch are processed by a separate core, to see the time you need to turn your wrist away from you, and then back, towards you. This gesture is programmed intentionally, and several times reduces false actuations, which has a good effect on the battery life.

  • The autonomy of the watch with the accelerometer on is up to 10 days in everyday use;
  • The autonomy of the watch with the accelerometer turned off is up to 25-30 days in everyday use;
  • With the accelerometer disabled, the watch can be stored for up to two months in sleep mode. 

 

You will receive a special milled keychain with laser engraving to enable or disable the tilt function. You can attach it to the your keys, and it will always be with you, it's convenient! 

Tilt function available only in Pro version of watch!

Unlocked options

UNLOCKED:

  •  - High Quality Stainless Steel straps in black or silver;
  •  - Handmade Leather straps in red or brown or black to your taste;
  •  - Custom laser engraving, possible to engrave any text or picture, any idea is possible!;
  •   - New unique body colors, Classic Gold and Nuclear Violet are available;
  •   - We obtained a unique color Plasma and texture of the case without the use  paints, by means of plasma irradiation.  The case has a unique texture and color;
  •  - A nice bonus - accelerated delivery of your reward!;

About limit of tubes

Take a look at this box. This box has not been opened for 25 years. These are untouched IN-16 lamps, which were stored in a closed military warehouse. It is a complete success to find several boxes of these lamps in 2022. There are not many Nixie lamps left in the world, perhaps the one of last boxes.

Don't miss this chance to get yourself a piece of the story.

If you support us!  

We have shown everything on the schedule for the fulfillment of all orders, we are also ready for amendments, so we purchased all the parts in advance. We are always in touch with you. 

Our partners from Ukraine have extensive experience in launching and coordinating projects in the field of crowdfunding.

 

Rewards

 

Tribute to the Nixoid Classic 

Without knowing history it is impossible to create the future. 

You can also get the Classic version of the Nixoid for the collection if you like. The quantity is limited to 50 pieces. Only a black version of the watch with a black strap is available. We will add this product to the rewards and will be available separately.

____Links

Customers love our watches!

 

Risks and challenges

Dear supporters, we hasten to assure you that we are all ready to start the project. We have behind us the experience of successful campaigns, and most importantly, we really value our reputation. We guarantee you fast delivery and will try to answer all your questions within 24 hours.

***Update 2/3/2016***

We reached our goal ...and only in two days!!! I am overwhelmed with the amount of support this cause received from the community and I feel so lucky to have met so many generous people. 

If you are just seeing this campaign now feel free to lend your support. Additional funds will be spent accordingly.

$3000-$3500 Taxes and Indiegogo fees.

$3500-$4000 Materials (plastic for printing) and Additional Utilities

$4000-$5000 3D Scanner (used for duplicating objects to be printed, potentially helpful for making casts and/or prosthetics etc)

$5000+ Software (Theres a number of different kinds of software I will be using to make this happen. Professional 3D programs like AutoCad are over $4000)


***Update 2/2/2015***

Thanks to Andrew McAllister, James Smith, Daniel Gray and David Rea for helping make the video. Also, thanks to Lara Schneider and Curt Johnson.

*** My Story ***

Hello, I'm Eric Rea. I am a designer in the video game industry and a big fan of new technology and design. I have been using 3d programs on and off for over ten years and recently have been exploring the wonders of 3d printing.

3d printing is a technology that has recently been growing incredibly quickly and has all sorts of applications, including medical equipment and adaptive devices. It is the perfect tool I need to make designs for disabled people like myself that will help them overcome frustrating physical hurdles.

You see, I'm not just a designer... I am also a quadriplegic. Because of my disability my hands are paralyzed and it makes some of the simplest tasks nearly impossible. Imagine the frustration of not being able to use a door knob, or dropping your phone every time you pick it up, or constantly hitting the wrong key on the keyboard. For folks like us, it feels like the world was designed for alien hands. However, I have been designing my own adaptive devices that help me overcome the limitations of my disability, and now I want to help others do the same. As it happens, I already have a network of disabled people in need of help.

For the last 7 years I have been a volunteer with the Spinal Cord Injury Peer Mentoring program at the University of Washington. I meet with newly injured quadriplegics who are ending their long stay at the hospital. Not everyone can afford continuing support from occupational therapists so I would like to volunteer my help as a professional designer, and as someone who understands what they’re dealing with. My goal is to work directly with these folks to help develop custom solutions for their adaptive needs. To achieve this end I need my own 3d printer.

This is where you come in. I need your help raising three thousand dollars to buy a decent 3d printer.  If enough people give even a small amount, we can raise the money needed for me to enable these people with better tools for independence. If you simply can't afford to donate, help me spread the word!

Thank you. 

Eric & Titus
story_txt:
***Update 2/3/2016***

We reached our goal ...and only in two days!!! I am overwhelmed with the amount of support this cause received from the community and I feel so lucky to have met so many generous people. 
If you are just seeing this campaign now feel free to lend your support. Additional funds will be spent accordingly.
$3000-$3500 Taxes and Indiegogo fees.
$3500-$4000 Materials (plastic for printing) and Additional Utilities
$4000-$5000 3D Scanner (used for duplicating objects to be printed, potentially helpful for making casts and/or prosthetics etc)
$5000+ Software (Theres a number of different kinds of software I will be using to make this happen. Professional 3D programs like AutoCad are over $4000)
